title: Anxiety or something else?
text:
Hi! It’ll be long I’m sorry.
So it all started with my Grandpa getting a brain tumor diagnosis after a stroke. I had the worst panic attack of my life after that, derealization stuck woth me since. Four days after i had a very bad tension headache, it lasted for about a week. Now there’s only pressure behind my nose and eyes, sometimes i feel sharp pain on the side of my head, but not that bad. After the headache got better i started to feel my ear is full, doctor said nothings wrong with it, but it’s ringing sometimes, especially when it’s quiet around me. I can’t function without my headphones or i’ll panic from every noise i hear, it’s like a bucket is on my head. I felt extremely dizzy, and had a blurred vision, which got better sometimes and then worse again. My symptoms got a little better, went for a walk with my boyfriend, than next day i got high fever and a bad flue. The last three days i didn’t eat much, so maybe that’s the cause, but the dizziness became worse. My legs are weak, i literally can’t walk, can’t make myself stand straight. I know the flue didn’t help, but i don’t know if that’s the tumor developing or my mind playing with me. Neurologist sent me to MR, but said i don’t have any symptoms in eyes or reflexes so probably anxiety. Help, i’m going crazy till the scan. It feels like im dying.

title: Health issues
text:
English is not my first language so bear with me here please.

My age is 20 now, I have health issues. When I was born, I have a rare condition on both of my arm which is called Radiolnar Synostosis. I didn't know that until I'm like age 7. Doctors said that they can't do operation because it is harmful and the bone will grow back as it was. I can't twist my arm and I got bullied alot, even in some of my family. I'm having trouble on writing, grabbing, climbing, almost all of activities that uses my arms. And then in 2019, I was having an immense pain on my lower back. When I went to a hospital, not a single doctor knows why. But on my xray I have a little bit of scoliosis but nothing harmful they said. I can't sleep everyday, literally. Everyday is always pain. It is not like something hitting you with a knife but the pain is more like an always eletric shock every second. When I lie down I still have that pain, as I'm writing this, I'm still having pain on my lower back. I can't control it. I feel like I need to always walk for it to become less pain. if I stop, it becomes worse. I did everything. I went to physiotherapy, I did exercise that is for Sciatica issues, doing it for years. My studies reputation went down because of this. I have soo much dream in my life. I was doing fine when this pain didn't struck me yet. When school, I always absent every week, like only 2 days I went to shool Everyweek. Teachers were insulting me because always absent even though I stated my problems and I was having good grades. Now I'm here, 5 years of my life, having this immense pain that I couldn't stop. I'm on University right now but I failed soo many exams. I tried. Now I feel like wanting to suicide. I tell my close friends and other loved ones about this issue. But they didn't seem to care. This life is soo unfair. I born into this world just to feel pain everyday. When I look into other people's life, I feel sad because I can't be normal like them. I don't feel happiness. Even if I did, it is just for a couple of minutes of happiness. I can't write properly, I can't drive cars comfortably, I can't do anything. I dreamed everything when I was a kid. Now, I just always wish something to happen for me to end this suffering. I just want people out there who is having a good healthy life, please, adore it.

title: How do you know when you need to get help / see a doctor?
text: I have been feeling off for over a year now for the following symptoms low motivation, crying several times daily, disinterest in gardening which has been my hobby for many years, general malaise, issues at work, extremely negative self talk, thoughts of death (not suicide, just generally feeling like death would be something of a relief), and weight gain. I went to my doctors last September to discuss options, he suggested we run blood work and get a sleep study. My bloodwork came back saying I have low Testosterone, vitamin D & B-12 deficient. I have been on testosterone replacement therapy since October 2023 as well as vitamins. I was also diagnosed after the sleep study with severe sleep apnea. I have been using my CPAP since middle of December 2023. I had hoped that doing all of that would have made me feel better, and in a way, I do feel better. But in my mind, I still have all of the symptoms that I have that I mentioned earlier. I'm still able to work, even though I am struggling at it. How do you know when you should go and get some additional help? Thank you.

title: Hitting rock bottom
text: I feel like I can’t pull myself out of this episode. I have a delayed grief reaction to my grandma passing away on Christmas. And I just think about how lonely my life is in general. I have constant crying spells and I’ve been missing work a lot. I have people I like to call my friends. Even if I can sense that they’re not doing well, I check up on them. Sometimes they acknowledge it immediately and sometimes they don’t for days/weeks. And it just hit me last night that they all know how close I was with my grandma and none of them have even sent a “how are you?” text after she passed away. This has always been how friendships have been, and relationships too. I always invest the kind of love I want from people and I get treated as if I’m insignificant in return. I feel like I’ve hit rock bottom with depression, grief, and loneliness. I have been posting thinly veiled cries for help online and still nobody in my circle has checked on me. I finally got one friend to message me back but they’re only talking about themself. And they bragged about how they spent the night with their friend who was having a rough time. Idk, I feel so terrible.

title: I want motivation and I want to know why I never have any
text:
It would solve so many of my problems.  I could finish college.  I could start working and saving money to get the apartment my bestfriend and I talk about all the time. 

I hate the word “lazy” but it’s all I think of and all I hear when I try to explain the depression I’m in.  

I just want my room to be clean. “Then clean it.”

I want to be healthy and fit.  “Then go to the gym. Stop eating fast meals.” 

I want to be beautiful. “Then take care of yourself, get a routine.” 

I feel like I literally can’t. I am 20 years old, I know so many stories of people being well and independent by now but I feel so stuck.  I am 100% convinced (or rather, hopeful) that I just have some sort of undiagnosed issue that is at fault for all of my struggling.  I just want to blame something for my failure and I don’t want it to be me.  


For the last two years I’ve been a high school graduate and I’ve done next to nothing with my life.  Sure I’m enrolled in school, but I’m like four months behind.  Because I’m signed up online and progression is entirely reliant on me being able to give a fuck.  Usually I spend my time just waiting til I can sleep, playing stupid video games that won’t matter if I plan on finishing my shampoo and conditioner at the same time.  

I just want to know what’s wrong with me

text:

My boss won't stop fucking with me, and my employer just doesn't seem to give a fuck that he's literally destroying my career and making want to fucking die. I can't fucking take it anymore. I try to use my PTO to avoid my boss because he fucks with me at literally every opportunity. I don't want to quit because I have a great career. I applied for a transfer but they're dragging their feet. 

And to top that off, one of my coworkers stole my wallet on Sunday. I have a GPS tracker in it, can see which truck left my workplace at the same time my wallet did. My old bosses and grandmother's funeral memento cards are in my wallet, and I want them back. That's all I care about. I've filed a police report and I know I need to inform HR but I just CCd them on an email where I was begging my bosses boss to transfer me and stop delaying and I'm honestly humiliated. 

I just want to stop existing. I feel like the stress is literally killing me. All I want to do is do my job and come home. And have just one baby with my husband. I've been struggling with infertility for years and it's absolutely pointless to continue fertility treatments while I'm under so much stress and I'm losing precious time. I can't take it anymore. I have always been extremely reluctant to admit I'm in this state of mind because I was involuntarily committed when I was 14 and it was kinda traumatic. But I really feel like I can't take anymore. I'm an anxious wreck, especially at work. My boss can be physically intimidating. He threatens to write me up over stupid shit constantly. My employer does N O T H I N G. 

I

Can't


Take

title: I feel like my mental health is negatively affecting my Girlfriend.
text:
Hello i am 21 years old and i have severe anxiety/depression, i attempted on taking my life earlier this month on the 6th of Feb (i've gotten the help i needed im doing good) and gradually,  i feel like everything that i say negatively impacts my partner in some aspect. she already deals with a lot on her mind but we both do our part as partners to be there for each other and to help one another as so far it has been working really well, we're both happy to extent until we feel shitty.

The one thing that worries me a lot is that ever since i started venting and talking to her about my problems regarding my self she would listen and do her best for me. but she neglects the idea of ever telling me about her problems which is crucial due how she deals with her own problems she feels like talking to me would only add more to my plate but in reality its never been in issue. through our discussions not only did it help her out it also made me find better solutions  and to see things in a different perspective not only to better myself but our relationship overall. , she thinks about self harm quite often and its scary, yeah i know who am i to talk i almost killed myself a while back but everyday i regret making the decision to end my life.

i just wish she wouldn't shut me out. i feel worried :(

( i forgot to add that she wants me to tell her my problems, so im being transparent and honest with what I've been feeling)

title: Slipping back into a Depressive episode and I have no idea how to get out of it.
text:
Hey everyone. I really need advice.

I am on two antidepressants (one also treats my OCD) and an anxiety medication(also for OCD$, so before you suggest getting my meds changed I find that my current blend works well for me. But it isn’t bullet proof, I know medicine isn’t a one stop shop to cured depression.

I am slipping into a depressive episode. My cat got cancer, the one creature that’s ever loved me unconditionally, and it’s all been downhill for me.

I feel it. I know it. I’m neglecting school work and important things to do useless hobbies I don’t even care about. I’m only kept alive by the useless obsessions and compulsions my useless brain makes me do, and sometimes I’m too miserable to even do my compulsions, worsening my anxiety and worsening my OCD symptoms.

I can’t go to class because I can’t focus. Going to my lectures are literally useless at the moment and I’m so behind. Im dragging down my class teammates and I can’t even bring myself to explain to them what’s happening.

I’m sleeping too much or too little. I just feel so hollow.

How do I even start to unbury myself from this hole? I have the desire to do something about it but not the motivation.

I need advice about stuff I can do myself. How do I start? Is it worth it? 

Thanks everyone.

title: People don't actually care if you're okay
text:
They only ask if you're okay to know if they want to spend time with you or not. They only care if you're okay enough to make them feel good when in your company or talking to you. Once they feel you're not okay, they will move on to other people. 

I've experienced it many times, just today at a gathering, my friend asked me if I was okay or not, once they found out I wasn't they moved away to other people who they could have fun with and feel happy with, which I understand to a degree cos it's human nature to be around people who are happy and laughing, but it's kinda bullshit how people fake concern only to see if you're worth talking to or spending time with. This is a friend whom I've helped during the toughest times and actually feel a lot for. It kinda hurt me when they did that but then I also felt guilty that I probably ruined their mood that they had to move away from me. 

At the end, Im only worth what I provide to people, if I can't provide anything, Im could rot under the sun, and no one would give a fuck. Im not great with words so I don't know if I expressed myself clearly what I was feeling but yeah...

title: Please shame me
text:
So this is gonna be a list of the things my boyfriend has done to me. If you can, please shame me for allowing somebody to do this to me. So I can get the willpower to leave this relationship. I’m so emotionally attached and I can’t let go. Even though I know it’s not healthy for me (and him). I seriously love him, but I don’t wanna live like this anymore. 

1. Has physically shoved me to the ground, or kicked me off of the bed.
2. Has thrown food at me when he’s gotten really mad.
3. Poured liquor down my purse, ruining everything inside.
4. Has scared me before.
5. Doesn’t know how to regulate his anger. 
6. Takes things out on me, only verbally/emotionally 
7. Makes a tinder for attention. I was complementing him enough. So it’s just to “boost his ego” (his words). He wasn’t talking to anymore. 
8. Has slammed my phone at the wall a few times.
9. Has told me details about his past sex life/partners. Even after I asked him to stop bc it made me uncomfortable.
10. Has shown me pictures of girls that he could fuck if he really wanted to. 
11. Has made comments about my weight. 
12. Tell me to stop talking whenever I get too excited about anything.
13. I always drive us around. 
14. I always drive to his place. It’s a 13 minute drive. But he never comes over to my place.
15. I pay for everything.
16. He owes me. $600+ 
17. He can afford a bottle of rum every 1-3 day. But can’t afford $7 flowers.
18. Has broken my stuff before.
19. Has stood me up for hours before.
20. Just throws me out the door of his apartment.
21. Has thrown my things out of his apartment.
22. It’s just always angry. Period
23. Wants to move in together, but doesn’t even want to add me on social media.
24. Tells me if I was a guy, he would fuck me up.
25. tells me I am victimizing myself when I start crying.

Small details: We’ve been together for a little over a year now. He’ll be 38 this summer. And I just turned 27. It’s not always like this. He has OCD and BPD, Still new to him. I do have ADHD, but I’ve learned how to cope with it(I still have my days though). I really do know he loves me. In his own way. I’m his good days, he’s literally perfect. On his low days, it’s a different person. 

And trust me, I know what you’re thinking. To whoever is reading this. I just needed somewhere to put my thoughts. I don’t think I’ll ever experience a human being like him ever again. he is absolutely the love of my life and my soulmate. And I have nothing but love for him. When I look into his eyes, I honestly see his hurt/scared inner child. The amount of things this man has endured his whole entire life, breaks my heart. And I will be forever sorry for any pain I have caused him.

title: The cruelest trick of nature was allowing humans to feel no care even for themselves
text:
Apathy drove me to commit many mistakes and failures to act on choices that matter that I’ll regret forever. Ignoring someone who tried to help me, letting a toxic partner stay in my life, hell even just sleeping on time. 

And at the root of it all is the fact that I can bring myself to care about me. Food, sleep, self improvement in general. I can’t be nice to me, I can’t be mean to me. The way I feel seems unchangable, and the way I act feels written in stone.

I’m 19 now, and for the first time I’ve found a friend who cares about me genuinely. And yet I’m caught driving our relationship to madness because i force them to watch me spiral. 

I’ve learned that It’s impossible to have someone in your life who cares for you, and simultaneously do nothing to fix your own problems. 

And yet on the other hand I can’t fix myself for them because that sort of improvement wouldn’t  be real. Hell, I’m not even sure if I could with that motivation.

And yet at the bottom of it all im not even capable of being a selfless human being, maybe if I can’t care about myself, I can care about others; but that’s not true, because the only thing I seem to care about in relation to me is TRAUMA. 

My trauma with men, with fears of abandonment, with jealousy, with cheating, with disappointment. The only things I clutch dear to my pain stricken heart are toxic learned habits that do nothing but make it impossible to trust others or find happiness. But the simultaneous apathy would be entirely fine with never sleeping.

Put it in perspective, I’d rather starve and be exhausted if it meant having a partner who would never cheat than have to deal with another cheater and be physically healthy.

What a cruel and horrible world to allow for a sentient being the desire to destroy itself on a crusade against demons it had never had a choice inviting into its life. I feel defective, like I took a fall like everyone else but mine hit an integral part of my programming. 

I’m tired of me, I’m tired of being broken, but I’m too tired to even do anything about it

title: Today I woke up and smiled when I realised I was alive
text:
This comes as a huge surprise to me. Exactly a year ago today was the last day of an extremely violent and bloody self-harm streak that lasted 9 days. 

Just over 5 months ago, my friends, my very foundation who had dragged me through my earlier episodes ditched me, made me feel unloveable, and made up lies about me.

I thought that was it. I cried 4 minutes into this year, knowing I physically couldn’t go through all that again, sobbing in fear of what I would do to myself if everything went wrong again.

But so far, it hasn’t. I’ve made new friends. I’m a little over two months clean. Life, as it stands, is pretty good.

Don’t get me wrong, I still get suicidal thoughts and urges to self harm, and I’m still incredibly insecure about my scars. But I think I can deal with it. You can too.

I made this post realising that a lot of people here feel like I did this time last year. Hopeless, worthless, lost.

I hate to repeat the same overstated cliches but there is genuinely light at the end of the tunnel. You have people- friends, coworkers, family members, who love you more than you could ever understand. Your presence means so much to them. 

And still, understandably, if you feel like that isn’t the truth, reach out to someone. Anyone. I get that I’m just some internet stranger but I hope that someone can be someone to you.

Here’s to hoping your lives turn around soon 🥂

I feel like I can't talk to anyone. No one cares, and when you apparently reach 21 years old your suppose to magically be okay and not have things like depression or anxiety or ptsd from an abusive alcohol mother.
So there must be something wrong with me. Even at 35 I still think about suicide.

title: lonely but not alone
text:
i (22m) never post things like this online but its late at night and my mind won’t stop. 

for about 2 years now i’ve been experiencing some hard hitting depressive moments, usually stemming from issues i have with my ultra conservative/christian family—more specifically my ex-pastor father. along with that, I also work night shifts in the health industry and it takes so much out of me with little to no satisfaction. 

My job is mostly solo work keeping me tied to a singular room without windows and little interactions with anyone my age/who’s not my immediate coworkers for 10-12 hr at a time. No amount of music or videos could distract me from spiraling hard every night.

Ive been living with my partner (29m) for a little less than a year + together for a yr 1/2 and my time with him has been amazing and i cant ask for a better partner, but I cant help but feel so much guilt coming home to him every morning feeling nothing but a void in my chest. Leaving to go to work is even worse, by then Im completely devoid of emotion or motivation and i cant even give him a proper reason why. im just not happy with anything or anyone when i feel that pressure in my head and just replay memories, thoughts, things ive should have said or done in my head. 

I have no friends, besides a conversation here and there with an old friend that has everything but the time and day for me and i dont blame them. I’m a loser. ive never beenextroverted, i didnt make it into any universities so i was forced to make the decision to stay with my parents through the entirety of what wouldve been my college years. Covid, on top of that, shifted my entire state college academic career online leading to even less human interactions i can get in a day. I lost all my friends, presence on social media and desire to continue my education.

Because of my job i havent been able to fully complete an entire semester of something i never wanted to do in the first place. Ive dropped out of more classes than Ive completed in the last year. I feel burnt out and choked up. its never enough for me and no matter how i frame my situation I feel like a failure and having a partner in the middle of it just makes me feel like im wasting their time and energy to console me but i dont know what to do.

im in pain after every shift, im constantly breaking out, restless at night, and overall numb and uninterested in everything. even if i try to pick up a hobby it leads absolutely no where.

time is my enemy. minutes, hours and days pass by me like nothing. Video games bore me after 20 mins, i hate watching tv or movies because i feel like im losing time when i could be doing something more useful whatever that may be. i never got to experience life free from anyone or without worrying about losing someone. I hate saying it but i wish i was alone so no one would care what i did.

im afraid all of these things im feeling is gonna result in me cracking. ive already accepted that im probably not gonna graduate and filled to drop out. 

I don’t know what to feel. Guilt? Anger? Satisfaction? I can’t help but feel selfish when i hear someone say how lucky i am or how grateful i should feel because i just dont.

title: Have Citalopram lost its effect? Switch to different SSRI?
text:
ER doc and new father since 7 months here. Been on Citalopram 40mg for a long time. Initially got it after consequences of several concussions/mild traumatic brain injury 15 years ago. Eventually went off it and later had a burnout with much insomnia, anxiety, dizziness, brain fog, lack of energy and likely depression. 

Went back on Citalopram, then switched to Mirtazapin. Felt absolutely awful until we added back Citalopram in combination. Reduced my depression score by half over just a few weeks and then slowly improved from the burnout(but suffered side effects so went off Mirtazapin after a year and continued Citalopram). 

After a few years of getting back to normal and now 3 years work as a ER physician I have since 1 year had similar symptoms and been on and off work/sick leave. Me and my psychiatrist chose not to change/add medication but since my rehabilitation is stagnant I feel something needs to happen. Difficult situation with a small child also. 

Currently unsure whether Citalopram has lost effect or if its just not enough. Have noted that side effects such as difficulty reaching orgasm is not as prominent as from what I remember previously. Could this be an indication that it has lost effect and that maybe a different SSRI may be sufficient? Otherwise I will have to restart Mirtazapin combination. 

Thank you for your insights and experiences.

title: Want to skip to the end
text:
In four months I (29,M) will graduate from college. At one time that seemed like a huge accomplishment--I was a high school dropout and for a while it looked as though college was not on the cards. I went to trade school, kinda liked it, and got a job that I came to hate. Then I got laid off during covid and decided to give college another shot. Fast forward a few years, and I'm on the cusp of a BA in Business. Well-regarded program, big university, competitive atmosphere...and it feels completely meaningless. I've been trained to spew convincing bullshit, but have no real skills outside rudimentary operations and data analysis. 

When I think about life after college, the bottom of my stomach drops out. There's a clear progression of things I SHOULD do: get an office job that pays ok, move out of my mom's place, save up, maybe travel a bit in whatever vacation time I can scrounge. Fundamentally, though, I know what my next 40 years look like: work, sleep, repeat. I'll be a mid-level spreadsheet jockey somewhere, doing my bit to make some asshole shareholders just that little bit richer.

"So what?" I can feel you thinking it. "That's life. Time to grow up. You have your health, you have a decent education, you have no debt and no excuse to whine. Nobody likes working, they do it because they have to pay rent and it funds the things in life that matter. Focus on the people in your life, on your hobbies. Be a man."

But what if there isn't anything that matters? Hobbies were never really my thing; I used to ski a lot but lately it doesn't do anything for me, just feels mechanical. My social life feels like a set of appointments on a calendar. I go out for drinks or go see a show the same way you might go to the dentist or get a haircut. Talk, drink, laugh, "This was so much fun, what are you up to next weekend?" Pretending makes me tired. 

Sometimes I think about how inconsequential we are as people. Everything in the world seems so big and important, but it's all happening on an infinitesimally small rock hurtling through an incomprehensively massive and mostly lifeless void. Before I existed, the universe went on for billions of years, and after I die it will continue for billions more. So what does it matter if my little blip lasts 90 years or 30? If we're all going to the same destination, why not take a more direct route? 

I've considered self-deleting, sometimes seriously, but don't think I could do it. Partly because I'm squeamish, partly because I'm an only child and it would completely destroy my parents. They're good people, I love them dearly, they love me, and leaving them in that level of pain is a pretty despicable idea. 

Maybe I'll get hit by a cement mixer tomorrow. Maybe I'll get cancer. But barring that, it's going to be a while. 

So, reddit, how do I make my time in the waiting room a bit more comfortable?

title: Who even am I?
text:
I 29M, am feeling the lowest I have ever felt. I feel like no one's even home in my head anymore. The days keep going by faster and faster. I want to make a plan for my future but I'm too busy flying by the seat of my pants in the current moments. There's no time to stop and think or make decisions.

My mom passed in October, I think I'm still coming to terms with the reality of that. And also realizing that she was the one that tied the family together. With her gone things are different. She's the one who would have made sure they attended my graduation or checked in on me from time to time. I opted not to walk for graduation because I doubt anyone would come.

I had a daughter in September, her mom left with her a couple months ago. I video chat her once in a while. We live four hours apart now and my current schedule and finances don't allow me to go see her very often. When I do see her it only brings more sadness. I want to be there for her firsts, I want to raise her, I want to know here. Last time I saw her she was afraid of me.

I try not to think about it too much, which is probably wrong. But I don't know what else to do, it hurts too much. I tried so hard to make things work, to do well in school to make moving with me worth it for them, fought through the burnout. Only for them to leave. My friends just say 'I told you so" or "You should have seen it coming everyone else did'. Why can't I fight through the burnout anymore? My reason to keep going is gone.

Her mom has since tried to apologize and tell me she was wrong and regrets leaving and has hinted at wanting to return, but I really haven't been able to respond to her on those topics. I just can't get back on that roller coaster ride with her. 

Not really sure what I'm posting for, to vent? Hopefully get some of these thoughts out of my head. I don't know. I'm tired.

Tired and angry and sad. That's all I am. I can remember the person I've been before. I can look back through my memories and see how that person gradually got beaten down and destroyed and now, I'm all that's left. Just a sad empty husk. I know the things that once brought me joy. Different activities or hobbies, but it all just feels like more shit now. 

They say it gets better. Life has ups and downs. What's the point when the ups are just a slightly less shitty version of the downs? It doesn't get better, just shittier. Like everything I do to try and better myself leaves me more alone, more miserable, and less alive.

I'm supposed to graduate college in a couple months, but I'm slipping hard. I want to care, I know part of me does care, and that I'll definitely care if I do mess this up. But right now I truly just don't care anymore. The work keeps piling up. My job continues to takeover priority and I'm just in a constant state of absolute burnout.

I can't think straight, can't focus, and I don't know why I even get out of bed. I just sit aimlessly until I can go back to bed. It's like I keep going through phases where my mind just turns off and it feels like five minutes have passed when in reality its been hours and I can't remember doing anything in those times.

I just want to rest. I want time to breathe and to think. I want to not be consumed by stress at all times. I think about death all the time. I don't actually want to die. I want to feel alive. But everyday I feel less so than the last.

I'm sure this will pass and I'll reread this post and delete it just like other times, only to return the next go around when it comes back stronger again.

Right now I really need to power through this schoolwork, but it feels so impossible. I'm not sure what to do. I need therapy.

title: Journal entry 2 pardon if there are grammatical and spelling errors I left my glasses on the dresser.
text:
Journal entry #2: 	I’m drowning  
Today has just started since it’s two in the morning and my burden of failure has carried over to this hour, of the next day. I feel worse than after the internship interview today. Maybe it’s because I was able to cry after I closed the laptop and release my sorrow, as compared to now, I want to cry but I can’t. Only small trickles will run down ever so slightly and only if I think about cutting my wrists. For some reason, I feel draining my blood will be an easier death than a heart attack. And I think the only reason I cry about it is because I know I’m entering that dark head space again. My head right now aches only slightly, my jaw is clenched, and the light in the room is making my eyes lower than normal. I’m so tired I’m drowning.   
I set my alarm for 9 hours so I could give myself time to fall asleep 30 minutes have gone by rolling in the sheets, covering my head with the forest green comforter, while having my eyes completely open. Watching my heartbeat through my wrist. The rhythm was smooth and faster than normal only slightly did it look irregular and that was when I thought about suicide. The medication does help, I can admit that. In addition, low intensity workouts and lowing my coffee consumption has made a large difference. My chest pains aren’t as frequent, and it is nice. Feels good to say something positive, but also ironic. Ironic that when I feel healthy I want to die, but when I feel god is taking me naturally I beg to live. I’m so tired I’m drowning.   
I have noticed when I can’t control my state of emotion that smoking cannabis doesn’t put me in a sense of panic compared to when I feel fine and in a way almost content. The thought of impending doom never crosses my mind when it’s inhaled on days of hopelessness. Before this sadness the last emotion I felt was irritability and then eventually anger. I didn’t have a particular reason why I was angry, I just remember thinking about violence and internally hyping myself up in fictional scenarios. Ashley and I got into after. Had another conversation about the same old shit but different location. Little does she know that her solution drains me. Drains my energy, my hope, my sense of positive thinking. Everything revolves around her, I could have got an A on an exam and lost 10 pounds or even won $1,000,000 but if were not good nothing is good. It’s been 5.5 years I’m starting to really grasp how dependent I am of her. The thought of her absence makes me ill. If she came close to me right now and hugged me it would be like medicine to this darkness clouding my skull. Yet, this relationship is a double-edged sword. Love is a double-edged sword. She is my sickness, she is my health, she is my drug. I am so tired I’m drowning.

title: How to get over self-hatred?
text:
I don't know why, but I've always set incredibly high standards for myself. Part of it may have to do with being labelled gifted in early elementary school, which shaped my identity such that everything I did had to be perfect in order to prove to myself and parents that I really was "gifted". I know I was insecure as far back as I can remember and always felt like I was missing something compared to other kids. I always felt uncool and struggled to connect with people socially even though I maintained a healthy friend group back then. Being "smart" was the only thing that made me feel acceptable.

I always fed off the love of my parents. I remember being afraid to advocate for myself because I didn't want to displease them. It was so bad that I could never say no to even the smallest things and I pretended to be enthusiastic about stuff I really didn't want to do. I don't really understand why I formed this deep sense of insecurity and dependence on the approval/love of my parents/others as I was never bullied or verbally abused. My current theory is that I received *too much* attention from my parents as a baby (my mother was extremely protective) which formed in me such a strong dependence on extrinsic love.

Anyways, for whatever reason I burnt out by the end of middle school and lost the motivation to really engage in academics and sports. I'm still trying to work out why I burnt out so fast, and I know part of it had to do with the heavy workload I received in middle school. Things really went downhill in the beginning of high school when I started receiving poor grades, which really upset my parents and subsequently me. I hated myself so much for the fact that I couldn't muster up the willpower to pay attention in class or do my homework and this exponentially increased the deep insecurity I'd been repressing. Suddenly the only thing I derived self worth from was ripped away from me. I had no idea who I was without my "being good at school". It didn't help that my friends were all high achievers which alienated me from them because I felt like I no longer fit in.

There was tons of stupid drama from that point on with self harm, drugs, shitty suicide attempt, mental health treatment, homelessness, etc etc. I'm 20 now, I got sober four months ago and I'm trying to put myself together so I can move on from it all. I've been doing lots of reflecting and have concluded that my deep depression has been a result of a severe lack of self compassion. I'm very ashamed of the narcissism and stupid drama of my adolescence but I also recognize that it was because I didn't know how to love myself.

In spite of this insight into myself, I still hate myself and feel inadequate no matter how much I tell myself I'm worth more than that. I've become acutely aware of this constant self-deprecating voice in my head and I don't know how the fuck to shut it off. It's kind of terrifying how little control I seem to have over the thoughts in my head. No matter how much I tell myself how pointless it is to be insecure, I can't control the constant shame I feel for the most minute, trivial things. In short, I have no idea why the fuck I can't love myself. I have no idea why the fuck I never had self-compassion to begin with and I feel it is the only thing holding me back from living a happy, fulfilling life.

I wrote this more just to organize the thoughts in my head, but I am still in desperate need of advice from people who may have experienced something similar. I mean, I know learning to love yourself is part of the human experience but I feel it's overwhelming how much I dislike myself.

title: i feel like i'm actually going insane
text:
For the last few months i've been spiraling to being a disgusting person and i really don't see myself ever being functional again. 
There's not a single moment in my days where i'm not thinking about either self harming, drinking until i pass out or fantasizing about someone straight up killing me, and it is so fucking tiring. For some reason i got a really bad addiction to imagining myself getting stabbed, and now i can barely stay still when i'm close to a knife.

It is currently 02:35am here and i have to go to work at 07:00, but i simply can't sleep because i don't want "another day" to begin, because i know that as soon as i have to leave my house, i will feel like puking.

I also became obsessive towards a person that i barely know, simply because she is polite to me, and it's got to a point where i'm only able to be in a normal mood when i'm thinking about her. She is not a good person either but i simply do not care, in fact it's almost as if because she is bad, she is able to understand what i'm feeling.

I am really, really, REALLY tired of having violent thoughts everyday. At college, work, home, anywhere, my brain is giving me the most gruesome images about my dead body, and it makes me happy in a weird fucked up way

Up until last year i was completely emotionless, i felt nothing towards myself and others, but now i feel like i finally got to my breaking point, and honestly i don't see myself turning back. It's like i completely lost track of who i was or wanted to be, idk.

sorry for the brainstorm, i just want to cry my eyes out but not a single tear comes out, so i had to type it out.

title: Never good enough
text:
If I was the man I wanted myself to be, I'd look back and ask why I held myself from becoming him sooner. If I was the man I never wanted myself to be, I'd say look in the mirror, there's nothing to change here. 
Trying to figure out, why this present man answers saying to the first: "Don't worry I'm headed right towards you" and to the second: "Your reflection is all I've ever seen, and nothing I do right changes that"
Leaves the present man wondering what he did so wrong, that in time everything he did right fails, and everything he did wrong flourishes into something worse.
He does good, and is rewarded with evil.
He does evil, and is rewarded with evil.
How will he ever be that man he wants to be when no matter how much he tries saying "don't worry I'm headed right towards you" to the good man.
Yet all efforts lead to "Your reflection is all I've ever seen, and nothing I do right changes that" to the man he never wanted to be.
Maybe it's time he stops thinking about both..

title: i have everything but im not happy
text:
I have a history of depression which dates back a couple years ago.

Growing up as the eldest daughter, I always felt alone because of the responsibilities I had. I was a straight-A student up until I got depression my sophomore year of high school. I flunked that year, but I was able to do a complete 180 and did better than ever.

Now, I am at one of the top schools in the world, but I still don't feel enough. I'm never happy. I am always overwhelmed with guilt and shame.

This is my first year of college, and I am not doing well at all. My academics are poor, and I am too stubborn to ask for help (academically and emotionally).

I really want to be put on medication. I cannot ask my parents for it because they felt shameful that they had a depressed daughter. They told me they were embarrassed when they knew I was depressed. I am not blaming my parents; they love me and will do anything for me. But one thing I will never do is ask for emotional help again. The amount of burden I felt was overwhelming.

Ever since I had depression, it never really went away. Sure, I did get significantly better, but even after years it is still present. I have resentment for so many people and I have so much resentment towards myself. Honestly, I wish I was never born.

I always have to be *this* and *that*. I have to marry a specific type of person, I have to be intelligent, I have to be feminine, I must be proper, I must not do *this* and *that*. I am so sick of it. I am sick of being my family's entire image. I am so tired of having my emotions undermined by everyone around me. It is not fair I always help my friends out, both emotionally and academically, but never get it in return.

I am this picture-perfect daughter everyone wants. But I am such a mess in the inside. Words cannot describe how much hate I have for this world. I wish it could end. I wish I did not have this burning sensation in my throat every second of the day because I have to hold back my tears. I hate seeing happy people. I hate it when my family is happy. I hate it when I am happy. I do not believe I deserve to be happy.

I wish I had an older sister. I wish I did not have to be the eldest child in the family. I am expected to help everyone else, but nobody is there for me when I need it. I am just told to toughen up.

I wish I didn't have to feel this way. I have everything. I have my whole life set up. I am guaranteed a high-paying job straight out of college. I am guaranteed to get accepted to a top grad program, too. I have so many connections with the top researchers of the world, so why do I have to feel this way? Why do I have to be so unhappy? I really do not understand why I'm so weak. I am really, really tired.

title: When it rains, it really fucking pours
text:
Christ, why is it when something goes wrong, everything else does, too?

I (M29) have battled with depression for the last five years. It’s a volatile battle, but I generally get through the dark days and things tend to get easier for a while.

However, recently, it’s really becoming difficult to see my life as anything other than absolutely written off. I’ve lost tens of thousands (70k), and I’m about 20k in debt. House and car have already gone - I’m now renting a shitty place and was driving a shitty car. I say “was”, because that car broke down today and the cost to fix it is way more than it’s worth.

My frustrations are showing at work. It’s causing me to be short with people and causing problems - I suspect I’m going to be laid off in a manner of weeks, at most.  

My life really feels like it’s now over - I don’t really see how I can crawl back from this, and, even if I did over the next decade, what is the point of living through such a grim struggle. I’m not overly scared of the prospect of death, I guess part of me has always hoped that things would get better - or I would make them better. But as the years go by, I’ve just made everything worse. At some point, it becomes sensible to just call it quits

I used to look forward to my birthday Now I just want it to be over I just want everything to be over.

title: The first time I didn't feel safe with myself
text:
I needed support yesterday and after being told by my go to person that they didn't have the space for me, I asked four more people. They all rejected me, because of good individual reasons. I think I give people a false sense of security. When they reject me, I brush off how much I need them, I tell them I will find someone else, that it's okay and show them a smile. 

But I was not okay, I have cried non stop for 3 hours. I have imagined myself dying, jumping into the ice cold water and slowly drowning, letting the soft hands of death take me away from the anxities. 

While going home I stayed as far away from the water and the traintracks as I could. I don't want to die, I want to finally live my own life. Be free from the control of my mother. I want to do a big endurance cycling event, I want to lift 100 kilo's, I want to decorate my own home, I want to teach a kid the wonders of life. 

I repeat those things to myself and hope they will always overpower that lurking hopelessness that wants to give up. I did not feel safe, I hope I can regain trust in myself.

title: Why can't i just be happy?
text:
Tldr at the bottom.

I (23m) can't seem to be happy. I have always thought that if i do this and that or change up certain things that i will finally be happy but it doesn't seem to work.

I have a good relations with my friends and family who support me. I am currently together with the girl of my dreams, who is pregnant with our first daugther. And we are currently looking into buying our first house. I have a well paying job that helps other people and keeps me physically and mentally active.

From the outside it would seem like i pretty much have it all but i cant get happy without a direct stimulus if that makes sense. My default state is always beeing depressed about something and if i dont immediately do something to cheer me up it always gets worse and worse. I cant seem to catch a break. 

I just dont know what to do anymore and thought why not ask people on here how they deal with their negative thoughts. I have tried changing my lifestyle to be more healthy, exercising, eating better, cuting toxic people out and surrounding myself with more positive people who i actually like.

Its not like my efforts have been for nothing. Its gotten better over the years don't get me wrong. I was just under the belief that i could finally have my default changed to positive. 

Tldr: I have tried everything i could think of and succeded but still am feeling depressed/suicidal and need some suggestions on what to do next.

Thank you for reading and have a great day!

title: I wanna die
text: I wanna die because for me,life doesn’t have a sense,and I suffer of depression,my life was full of depression and oppression,I hate myself,I’m worthless and I’m tired of this life.

title: The future seems so hopeless and bleak I don't know what to do
text:
I don't even know where to start. This is going to be long so I appreciate whoever reads this. I decided to try posting this because I literally feel like I am hollow entity just existing and I need someone to hear me. For some background though I guess, clinically I have major depressive disorder and GAD. I suspect I have some other mental illnesses (BPD and maybe ADHD) but have not been officially diagnosed yet. I am also on medication: Prozac. I've been on it since 2018 and I hate it. It was supposed to be a short term thing but I am very much still on it and see no end in sight. I was doing the best I have ever been in my life (granted I still had some major lows of course but averaged out) from 2022 up to the end of last year. I met the sweetest girl and am still in a very serious relationship with her. She has been my only and best friend since I met her as well. She was born and raised in another country and has lived here in the States for around 10 years. At the beginning of this past December she moved back to her country for college because she couldn't afford to go here. She is planning on moving back after she completes her degree there. Things have been pretty difficult for her there so far and whether she will be able to get into school is still up in the air. 

And the distance is killing me. And while I have been trying to be a lot more transparent with her about how I've been feeling and doing, I feel like I can't be 100% because I don't want to stress her out any more than she already is. Despite us calling every day and having no real reason to worry because our relationship is still strong and both of us are still determined to see this through, I have an extremely anxious attachment style in general and the long distance and bad internet there has made it so much worse. I have been struggling with constant obsessive behaviors like checking her social media profiles way too much, checking my phone to see if she texted me/when was last active every chance I get and spamming her with messages. 

My depression and anxiety have been off the chart these past two months. I'm at community college currently and hoping to transfer to a real school in the fall. I've always struggled a lot in school due to my mental health. My current GPA is on the lower side (not horrible) and I still have no idea what I really want to do for a career. I want to do something that will make 100K because I want to be able to provide for my girlfriend and our future life together, especially in a time when our economy is insanely bad, but I don't even know if that's possible considering my mental issues. I've been really struggling this semester too because of the big life change being long distance. I'm also working part time to save money to buy a flight to visit her for a month in the summer. I'd love to not have to work since school is stressful enough but I'm going to have to if I want to see her in the summers for these next few years because my parents don't approve of me visiting her and she can't afford to come here. Tickets are average about $2000.

I feel so hopeless. I'm wrestling with passive suicidal thinking, self harm and self destructive behaviors almost every day. I have frequent panic attacks and am super anxious anytime I am not texting with or on call with her. I get about 3-4 hours of sleep a day, any more than that and I'll get really bad, realistic nightmares. I know I need to stay strong for my girlfriend and she is the only reason I'm still here. Then the positives. They are not many and definitely feel outweighed by the bad but they are something I guess. I've been trying to replace my self harming with working out. I started boxing as well. I'm trying to get big (have always been pretty skinny) for my girlfriend when I see her you feel me lol. But other than that the only relief I get is doing my hobbies (very scarcely though because of anhedonia) and smoking weed. I threw my shit away though because it was becoming extremely unhealthy and was smoking way more I wanted/needed to. I am going to start again because it really did help me find relief but I'm gonna have a very honest conversation with myself that I have to use it responsibly and if I can't then I won't use it at all. 

That's pretty much all though. I feel like I'm crawling at this point. I don't know what to do other than find whatever little reason I can to keep going every day but the future just seems so hopeless. Thanks for reading if you did, I hope you have a blessed day/night :).

title: Am I finally getting better or am I spiralling worse?
text:
I’m about to graduate school but I feel like I barely have any crazy memories (it’s all blurred) and haven’t lived my teens enough, I’ve never been in a relationship and I barely went out through my teenage summers due to depression and anxiety although I had very good friends and enjoyed my time through school (although felt very lonely and rotted in my room)

I’m aged 18 and finally breaking out of this shell that’s had a hold on me since I was maybe 14/15 , however I feel like everyone has matured and grown past me and had experiences that have aged them mentally while I’m still a child,

Is it too late to live life? In these next 2 years I will have to build a life while also trying to play catch-up with my teenage years and try do everything in a rush, but I feel like everything I wanna do is what school kids (13-17) are doing and I’m gonna look like a weirdo. 

Im still a virgin and yet to have my first kiss because to be honest I was never into the girls that were in my school despite having a pretty quite large amount of girls crushing on me throughout the years, but now I regret not going further with them because everyone seems now to be experienced with boys and a lot more mature now while I’m mentally 14! 

I have a crazy motivation to live life and I’ve been talking to people a lot more and reconnecting with people I pushed away to try and salvage these last teen years

I feel like maybe people who didn’t live as crazy in there teens will try and over compensate in there late teens/20s (usually ppl with strict parents ig) and people who lived crazy in there teens begin to settle down in there later teens or 20s so maybe I’m not as far behind as I think 

Am I mentally insane or do I still have a chance at life

title: I don't care about anything
text: I can't get up in the morning sometime. It physically hurts to do so. I try my best to shower and brush my teeth to not be disgusting but it's very hard. It's been about 3 years of this and meds don't truly work plus visits to the psychiatrist are very expensive. I growing more and more desperate because I tell people I'm not doing well even family an they don't care. I don't care either but I want to make it clear and not have them be mad a me if they realize I get worse.

title: Abandoned
text:
I’m a 35F (soon to be 36 in a few days) and I think it’s my time. The anniversary of my mamas death was last week and today my best friend of 10 plus years just told me she’s taking a “break” from our friendship because my depression is unsettling. I can’t hold on anymore. That was my last straw. 

I’m just forcing myself to be here because for my sister. But, honestly that’s not worth it to me anymore. I just want to cease to exist. Everyone eventually abandons me because of my mental health struggles. 

Thanks for allow me express here.

title: Should I just accept that not everyone is meant to succeed in life?
text:
This might be a long read but they say talking helps. 25M here and my life is at a standstill. No career, no house, no car and nothing to my name and I'm trying my best. Day in day out I keep showing up for myself trying to better my situation to no avail. I'm not just sitting twiddling my thumbs and hoping for a miracle I keep trying everyday even on days where I have no motivation I still push myself I might not give it my all that day but I give whatever I can muster up. It's getting exhausting now to try and fail every single time maybe I'm being naive by thinking I can get what I want exactly the way I want it but... What was the point of me setting all those goals for myself, what was the point for aiming that high.

Realistically speaking clearly my "best" isn't good enough and maybe I should just accept that not everyone is meant to achieve their goals or succeed in life, it's sad and hard to accept but that is the reality I'm currently living in and it's not changing at all. I really tried, I'm tired of always having to pick myself up I want to give myself a pat on the back for once.... Just once. Honestly I'm not asking for overnight success but to see results no matter how small or "insignificant" I might deem them to be. Just so I can have a visible reason to keep going and not just hope that it'll get better one day. 

Knowing myself I will keep trying regardless lol the life I want to live is too pretty to give up on it but that light in my eyes is slowly dimming with every failure and really I can't wait for that day it finally fades ...coz then I'll have the courage to end it all and I'll finally be at peace. Life is too harsh for me and maybe death will comfort me then I'll never have to worry about what could've been had I not given up... I'll just never exist

I just dont see anything anymore. Every avenue, every door has some sort of block behind it. I know that whatever I want to do is impossible. I dont care about anything beyond short term pleasure. There's no way out. I'm simply just a worker bee designed to live a mediocre life & answer the dreams of someone else. My mind is trapped in the slowly decaying cage that is my body...just withering away and forgetting who I am.

title: I stopped taking my antidepressants
text:
Around 1 month ago I stopped taking the meds that have been doing their work for a year. It was not a conscious decision; I just kept forgetting to take them and then I couldn't start. Now I don't really want to, but now I'm feeling extremely lonely. I've always struggled with loneliness; the feeling of not having a significant other and not being someone else's n°1 priority (besides themselves, ofc) is one of my biggest issues.
I wanna know if this intense feeling is just a few bad days/weeks or if this is really how I feel without the medication. Do you think is worth the try? I mean, not getting back to the meds until I figure out if I start feeling better or not.
Also, even before I stopped taking the meds -around 3 month ago, I started longing for a partner. Is it normal? Until then, I was comfortable being single; I was working on myself (I got back to uni) so I really didn't mind not having a partner. Do I want one because of the progress I've made? Is it the loneliness? Is it both?
For the record, I have an amazing relationship with my sisters and with my two best friends. I also started a group activity where everyone is super nice and cool to hang out with. But the loneliness is there, does anyone want to share their thoughts?

The only time people remember me is when they need my help or money. I just so sick of it. I've tried more weed and even started drinking again but still im just numb and nonexistent

title: Don't really wanna die. Don't really wanna get better. Just wasting time until something forces me to choose
text:
I've spent such a huge portion of my life dealing with the same exact problems and it's not getting any better, but I'm also not doing anything to improve. Always struggled with school, and never learned how to talk to people or make friends or do anything by myself. I'm currently in my 3rd year of university (20 yrs old. Not at all proud of myself for making it this far), yet I still fail to accomplish the most trivial tasks, like writing an email, making a phone call, replying to messages, doing homework, cooking, cleaning, exercising, and so on. I've never had a job, nor do I have the social skills or willpower to get one. All I can do is leech off my parents until they tell me to grow the fuck up. I've struggled with ADHD for as long as I can remember, anxiety since 4th grade (8-9 yrs old)(might've had it longer, but this is when it started interfering with school), and suicidal thoughts since 5th grade (9-10 yrs old), but I don't think I was actually depressed until 7th or 8th (11-13 yrs old). I started seeing a therapist in 8th grade, and continued to see her until my first year of university; however, I would often put off scheduling appointments or forget to do so for long periods of time. She wasn't happy about that, since therapy doesn't really help if you don't go, but I just can't be bothered to put effort into anything, so I eventually stopped making appointments altogether. I've been taking antidepressants since 9th or 10th grade, when I started dealing with OCD on top of everything else; now I'm on 300mg of wellbutrin, and I'm supposed to go up from 175mg of zoloft to 200mg. This took care of the OCD (save for a few lingering "quirks"), but I don't think it's doing jack shit for my depression and social anxiety. 

Sometimes I feel like I don't want it to get better; I just want it to go away. Sure, I'd probably feel better if I ate right, exercised, did my homework, meditated, went back to therapy, etc., but I'd rather pretend that the problem will somehow fix itself if I continue doing fuck all. The only way I know how to deal with difficult situations is to ignore them. I'm too much of a coward to kill myself, so instead I'm just letting the years go to waste until I either get the motivation to fix my life or the guts to end it. With how absolutely fucking incapable I am at everything, maybe it would be better to erase this mistake altogether. Do I even deserve to be alive if I won't put in the work to become a functioning member of society? I don't know.

Writing it all out feels so surreal, because I know it's all true and yet there's still a strong disconnect between the me that's cognizant of my problems and the me that's always distracted. Shit, I don't even know if this is how I actually feel. I ran out of zoloft almost a week ago and I can't get a refill because of the cyberattack. Sorry about the wordiness; I have a lot on my mind and no one to talk to.

My long-distance girlfriend just broke up with me after a two-year relationship because she is tired of trying to put in any effort, I don't like staying where I came from because I wasn't able to grow and thought the move might help. I feel like I'm drowning, I can't feel any good emotions, and I am slowly burning through my savings. I feel like an alien among everyone I know. I don't know what to do. Everyone likes my work and compliments my personality, but I can't seem to gain a win in any part of my life. Why does the world seem like it'll swallow me whole?

title: Being alone for a long time sucks
text:
Lately I've been isolated in my room in front of the computer almost 10 hours a day for work. I'm home alone and don't really have friends or family or anywhere I can go since I also struggle financially and lately seems like you need an insane amount of money to do the most mundane things. Hate the economic situation badly...
I don't have a partner either so basically I don't have anyone to really talk or to rely on. No money for therapy, the free resources have an infinite queue that will keep you waiting for so much time. 
Days like today I feel so lonely. Like there's no one to catch me when I'm about to fall. 
I have been supresing the tears for so long. I don't really remember the last time I cried. Specially since I'm so busy lately. I thought that if I didn't have the time to even cry my mind will stay at ease, occupied with other stuff. But the more time passes by the more I realize I'm just putting on a facade.
I'm so tired and lonely. Feel like anything I do is enough. Taking care of my family problems and being others punching bag. My mom is around for some time a day due to her work but when she is home she mostly talks about work problems and honestly I don't even know how to respond to her. I'm home alone not even able to talk to a human face to face to keep paying the bills and the little time I get to be with her she keeps complaining about work and being tired.
I feel bad for thinking this way, but why do I have to endure her problems and my ongoing depression and problems too. It's so unfair. That's how I think sometimes. And it makes me sick, I feel like a child who just complains and puts the blame of their shitty life in someone else. 
I guess I just want to feel like there will be someone for me when I feel like this. I'm not asking for advise or for them to listen I just want someone to hug me while I cry and feel like I'm not doing this for nothing that my existence is valued by someone that there is someone I can look for.

title: What my therapist said
text:
I am pretty depressed for the past few months. I have lots of suicidal ideation, I fantasize about it often. I was looking for advice because I notice it’s a pattern in my life for me to feel this depression a few times per year or maybe 1 big depression each year. She basically said I should have more grit, stand up for myself, and stop taking shit from people.

A big part of what makes me feel depressed is my job (I hate it but don’t feel like I can find anything better). And my interpersonal relationships (my friends aren’t very kind to me and I’m extremely single even though I have gone on many dates and put in effort, and I don’t have the best family situation so I live across the country from them). So in short I’m very lonely and the connections I do have make me feel even more alone. 

She said I need more control in my life. 

She said I should start going to church again and try to rely on those communities for that connection. I actually agree with her. I also need to take more steps towards getting a new job. I work with middle schoolers and was assaulted by a student at my job a few weeks ago, and now even though I’m in different classes students are still very rambunctious and loud and very disrespectful.. it really wears on me and I feel anxious constantly. I’m just in the depressed there is no point to life mood at this point but I’m hoping I can get myself out of it because I don’t want to take medication.

Adding on to that, I feel like I have no talent and I’m boring. I zone out when I talk to people and can’t hold a conversation. Please help and thank you.

title: Fighting the good fight
text:
Long time lurker, first time poster. 31(m), I lost my sales job in December of ‘22 a month before my 30th birthday. Before that job, I’d worked in sales and saw success for 6 years, and decided to take a leap of faith into a more volatile industry and was chewed up and spit out.

It wasn’t until June of ‘23 that I found a new sales role, but at this point I had worsening symptoms of anxiety + depression, and my normal “body armor” of substance use was no longer serving me. I was even offered a new job in March of '23, which was quickly rescinded after failing a drug screening and testing positive for cannabis. I live in Colorado and my previous role was with a cannabis company, so I naively thought it wouldn't be a big deal. 

This sent me on a sober journey that I’m still battling as I’ve now been sober from cannabis for 319 days, alcohol and nicotine for 141 days. I haven’t relapsed since deciding to quit but feel like I’m white knuckling it most of the time. I’ve even given up all social media (except Reddit) hoping to find some sort of euphoria, clarity or at least an intrinsic motivation that I’ve yet to see. I was a daily weed smoker for 10 years, and had been drinking socially since I was 14 - after some pretty intense bullying in middle school - which has probably had a more intense impact on my mental well being than I care to admit.  

I was highly functional in my substance abuse until Covid, which seemed to derail my mental health more than I was aware of at the time. I even trained for and ran in a marathon in under 4 hours in hopes that I it would change my life and how I looked at myself.  It it did for a short amount of time, but ultimately worsened my depression afterwards. I can’t seem to shake the idea that there’s some silver bullet out there that will fix me, whether it be a new job, new girlfriend, or new way of living. I feel like I’m stuck in a trance of unworthiness, which has grown exponentially worse since turning 30 and the dread of getting older continues to settle in. I feel like I need to constantly be accomplishing something, or standing on some moral high ground of self discipline in order to be worthy of love and happiness.

I’ve been seeing a therapist since November of last year, and even took a leave from my current job to take part in an intensive outpatient program for adults struggling with depression that meets three days a week. In that time I’ve tried CPT, CBT, DBT all with varying levels of relief but still struggle some days to get out of bed. Some days feel like huge breakthrough, and others feel like I’m back to square one. I just feel like such a fuck up and can’t let go of the idea that I’ve failed or won’t find happiness as I continue to get older. I let my job define my self worth so much that when I lost it, I felt like a shell of who I once was.  Loneliness has become more prevalent as I’ve gotten sober and tend to avoid social interaction. I think I have social anxiety that I numbed with substances for a majority of my life. Emotions hit me like huge waves, but I welcome them the best I can. Other days I feel completely numb.  

I hoped to feel increasingly better as I continued to remove substances from my life, but it only revealed a depression I’d been numbing for much longer than I’d realized. I’m so tired of being hard on myself for my past, and wish I could focus more on the good things in my life because there are so many to be grateful for. I’m so extremely lucky to have a loving and supporting family/friends but it feels hard to face them when I feel so numb, I feel like something is broken inside me and it won’t get any better. Weed helped me shut of that voice for so long and now I feel like I've abandoned myself by giving it up. At many points in my life, my relationship with weed felt like it was saving my life, not hurting it - and I am struggling to appreciate why I gave it up in the first place.

I write this because I’m hoping to connect with others who’ve experienced something similar, and to express gratitude for communities like these that lift its members up. We are all messy humans just trying to get home. I stand with you all, fighting the good fight in hopes of living a happier and healthier life for ourselves and those who love us.

TLDR; Sometimes it gets worse before it gets better. Getting sober showed me stuff I needed to work on that I didn’t even know was there, but I’m grateful for those who sit with me in the struggle and love me when it’s hard to love myself.

Edit: grammar/spelling

No one.
