title: Trying to find control in anything I can.
text:
Hey I'm not sure if this is considered the right place but I realized that I am searching for control in my life. I don't take care of myself because I don't want to do my best and be told it isn't good enough.

I have a scraggly unkempt beard and I don't do anything with my hair, it's usually sticking up. I am also kinda lazy I guess but it's less of that and more what's the point?

I hate myself so much. I have been taught to hate myself and guilt by others. But if I instead love myself and say fuck everyone else then I'm good. I do this weird thing because I feel I have no control in my life. 

Like I don't want to be clean. I don't want to take care of my self and I don't want to be better. I don't want to be everything everyone wants me to be. I kinda joke that I see myself as like diogenes and I like the fact that the guy did whatever he wanted. But the guy would pretty much be seen as a crazy homeless man today.
It's funny too cause like I have lived a pretty decent life materially speaking anyway and if I lived like that I would literally be homeless.

Idk I just am angry at the world. I was hurt a lot as a kid and I never really got over it. I was so naive and that was what I hated the most out of myself. I was so easy to be taken advantage of. 

So I am now a cynical and bitter old man. Or rather I feel like one in my 20s. I used to be so outgoing and fearless and kind etc. And now I fluctuate between fearful to do anything and anxious and self hating. To complete nonchalance and willingness to be brave and just not give a shit no matter what happens. 

I just want someone to tell me what to do. But if they tell me I will tell them to fuck off and do my own thing... I spent so much time doing what other people tell me. It's fucking with my mind.

I don't really even feel alive honestly. I just feel like I am a passenger in my own life. I would rather fail of my own accord then succeed following someone else.

I am struggling. I wish I was not cursed to put other people before my own. I feel like I must always be subservient to others. I feel I am not worthy of anything. 

I feel worthless. I feel I am a completely worthless person. And I have felt this way for decades. The only value I have is as a "jester" or as someone who doesn't care what other people think. 

I put on a brave face sometimes but in reality I am a hurt sensitive person who tries to be strong and doesn't know how. Everyone keeps hurting me if I am open and soft so I harden and become strong and bitter. A bit of hate too, and then I get told "hate is bad, it's your fault!" It's almost funny. 


Like imagine a kid being told he is just as bad as the bully because the Billy's hand is sore from beating the kid so much... dang morally is just so questionable who really is in the right here? They are both as bad? That didn't happen to me that was just an example.

I don't even know where I am at here I'm just ranting. I feel like I have no control over my own life. Ironically I actually made some small improvement in my life recently, I stopped playing video games for a couple weeks and am happy I did. My life has been getting better or at least I am able to get to work a bit easier. 

But like what's the point? Work will still not be as exciting as fun things. But even thought it has been stressful some parts have been interesting and I am figuring things out. Part of me also wonders why I even try to be better anyway if life sucks so much.

I guess I just have no hope for the future, I remember when I almost got hit by a bus 10 years ago by accident and I was actually sad it didn't end me. I still feel that way sometimes. 

I hate myself so much. I fluctuate between these feelings but I have hated myself for decades. I hate myself when I sacrifice everything and turn into a soulless yuppie workaholic doormat. I hate myself when I say fuck it and just survive. I hate myself when I say fuck the consequences I am doing my own thing. No matter what I do I can't be content. 

Ironically the one thing that I have found has brought me peace, is when I say fuck the consequence. I don't care about anyone else's opinions or thoughts. I will not be put down and treated like shit. I don't care about the consequences I will live free. I am ok with losing a fight if I am honest with myself. It's not about the result it's about the choice.

My mind is slipping. Or well it's been slipping for years but I haven't been taking care of myself. Honestly right now all I can do is hold on and do the bare minimum. I have a job, and my own place, and a car, and I don't have any responsibilities like a wife or kids, I have the capability to do fun things like watch movies or play games or find something good to eat. Well I guess scratch the video games but yeah. I dont have too many wants really.

But I still get like this. No matter what happens in my life I don't think I will ever he happy. I can win the lottery tommorow and win a billion dollars... after taxes and then I will just be worried about losing my money!! I will find some cool things to do and I won't worry about survival but then what? I literally would not be happy with a billion dollars. I would still pick to have it tho lol cause I would rather be sad with money then sad without money. 

Idk what I am even saying anymore I'm going to sleep and will probably delete this at some point. My life is getting better, but no matter what happens in my life it feels like I always come back to feeling like this. Today was alright. I will focus on doing what I can. Don't need to be perfect just need to move my legs forward. I would rather fail on my feet then fail when I could have done something. I accept I am not perfect no matter how hard I try to be. I accept I make mistakes. I will just take things day by day, I will not worry about 10 years in the future or 10 years in the past. The only me that exists is the present not the future or past. I will do things thst make me better or make me happy that's all I can do. 

I will not worry about the future no matter what happens I will accept and try to change what i can.

title: suicidal help
text: i am 23f and i have always had depression as long as i can remember. typical stuff, triggered by a SA as a minor and manifests as never having any energy or peace in my mind. i sleep 10 hours or more a day if nobody stops me and i just got scammed online for a huge amount of money and i am starting to realize that i am more of a burden to myself and others than i could ever be useful. i have decided to kill myself and i just wanted to ask some strangers if they have any suggestions before i make life even worse for my family, i care for them but they are constantly having to help me with money and housing cause of how incapacitated i get in winter  . i’ve already given away all of my stuff so i don’t think that would hurt them, i think i’m just going to go out into the woods to do it. anything helps thanks

title: it's never going to be better
text: I'm posting this because I don't really have anyone who I can pour my heart out to. Truth is, everything has gotten worse since 2020, when the pandemic had a really big impact on my mental health. I'm a very shy person, who has a lack of communication skills hence I can't hold a normal conversation with anyone, because I always become awkward/embarrass myself. In the past, I used to be very optimistic about my problems, I used to think that everything will have a solution. Now, I'm just hopeless. I don't have time for myself at all because I always have to study/I don't have enough energy to take care of myself. I keep asking myself what's the point of self care if I'm gonna die soon  (I don't see myself alive past 25 or lower because I can't function properly). I have lost many opportunities, thinking that I would always fail, because I'm really stupid, even though I have the highest marks in class. But that's because I spend a lot of time studying instead of doing something for my wellbeing (I don't want to disappoint anyone). Despite this fact, I'm really convinced that I'll be a total failure. Generally, I feel alright when I'm anchored in the present, but when it comes to thinking about the future, I start crying. Im finishing highschool in a year and I have to think about choosing an university. Problem is, I haven't figured out what I like yet. I can't try new things because I don't have enough time for that. Almost the entire time I'm in my room. It sucks that, in the end, I would have to choose a random university which other people might have chosen based on their passions. Life is really unfair. I don't know what I want from it, and if something comes to my mind, I would always deny it because the chances of achieving it are quite low. I really hate myself.

title: I think it's time
text:
Short and to the point. It's time for me to kill myself. I know people will say it's not the answer. This consumes my life, everyday. I'm 38, had this I was a kid and nothing gets better. Going through to much trauma and abuse, being trapped in my life and cycles of just fucking up everything. I'm burnt out from helping out a family member who refuses to do anything to help themselves and dragging me with them. 
I knew I would end up like my father who took his own life. 
Like father like son. 
When I figure out the where I can do it it will be done in a few weeks.

title: At some point I lost the ability to even demonstrate I'm feeling bad (venting)
text:
I am 21y old and are openly trans to almost everyone (including my parents but they just ignores it and acts like I never told them nothing about it).

So, when I was younger I really had depressive crisis, I didn't eat, shower and that kind of thing. Of course people get worried about what was happening to me. But, as the time goes and the feeling doesn't go away, and I started to understand what I was feeling better, I kinda lost the ability to demonstrate I'm feeling bad. I surely control my depressive and anxiety tendencies better now. But at some point it stopped to be about me getting better and started to be about me getting function as an human being.

I feel I just needs to keep going. Going to college, trying to eat well, sleep enough, interact with people that like me as much as I like them. But that is not true, I just suck at feeling good, I'm not sad just right now, I'm sad.

Day in day out and nothing changes. I still have the same fear of death and in a paradoxal way, a death wish. I think I just want to go over it soon. I still counting the days I'm prohibited to live like myself. I look the news and doom scrolling just to confirm that the world wants me dead or people with big money are destroying it.

I feel that way since I was like, 5 years or something. Sometimes I blame my parents, thinking they cursed me. Sometimes I cursed the people that throw hate towards me just because I was a little fat when I was a kid, or because I'm autistic. 

Sorry, it ended up being too long.

title: I don't know how or what I feel
text:
there's a lot to unpack here, but i might as well start from the beginning;

at 2 years of age (2009), my father and mother divorced and my mother won custody and from then on, I've been living with my mother, seeing my father every Wednesday (which then changed to Tuesdays due to his work schedule). Until he moved to Florida in around late 2019-to early 2020 (before COVID hit, and for personal reasons I don't want to squander), but before that, he had a child (my half sister) in 2012, and when he left for Florida, she was devasted, and broke down in tears when he left (i will come back to this later, but we have to get back to the point, the beginning is already long enough).

at 3, i was diagnosed with ADHD, and autism in 6th grade; i was a good kid, a bit of a trouble maker, but i was an overall good kid. and I struggled with speaking my true feelings, i just followed the crowd and was (probably) seen as the naïve kid that was too kind for his own good. I was truly too kind.

in December of 2017, my grandfather (my father's father) lost his life in his second battle with cancer, my entire family was devastated, but mainly me; i was 10 when that happened. yes, i knew death was dangerous and was not to be taken lightly, but to have it happen to a loved one i held close to me be taken from life hurt me, and my little 10 year old brain couldn't handle it, so for the next 2 years when ever my grandfather (I'll just call him "papa", because that's what I've always called him as a kid) came to my thoughts or even being mentioned around me, i would only cry; cry, cry, cry, all the tears just went down my cheeks, i couldn't handle it.

somewhere when i was in 5th(?) grade, my mother was in a car accident that made her quite disabled, she would have seizures, she could have mood swings, and she would become verbally aggressive if her top blew off,

and back to when my father left for Florida, my half-sister (I'll just call her "cis") called me on her phone and cried through the speaker, and I did something i still regret to this day, I told her to grow up. to get over it. it wasn't until years later that i was told first-hand that I was just used to my father leaving (we still have a good relationship, and this is probably why I don't feel any hate towards him), a week after i told cis this, i did apologize to her, so do not worry.

in December of 2019, an event in my life came to fruition that i could never forget: i wanted to take my own life. it was something huge in my life, none of us could EVER forget; my parents found out, my father found out, a huge amount of my family found out, and I was sent to "mercy hospital", somewhere in Illinois. for the time i spent there, it was the LONGEST 3-4 days of my life; i was then let out with pretty much a pat on my back and a "don't come back here again, suic\*de is a no-no." it stuck with me in a bad way, and I've developed this warped, twisted view on suic\*de as the "cowards way out of life" (call me out and/or hate me if you want, i understand your judgmental feelings, i hate that i think this way as well).

this next event I'll shed on lightly, because it hurts my mother deeply, but my uncle (at the age of 40-41), was m\*rdered in July of 2020. it devasted my entire family, just as much as papa's passing. it only made my mental health even worse, as well it made my mother raise her tone when she angry to an 11. if she became too mad, she would make fun/call out your own problems and dreams and compare them to her own, and how they were squandered for her. but she was still a kind woman, and i admire my mother, good and bad just like my bio-father (my mother married my step-dad in 2016).

and now in 2024, sophomore in high school, have a 3.7 GPA (due to being pushed by my parents, peers, and other family members), and I've begun developing feelings and/or problems mentally:

1. i hate being around people, but i hate being alone and/or forgotten.
2. i hate being threatened, along with threatening other people.
3. I've begun to have constant nightmares (3-4/7 days of the week) where i lose control and hurt the people i hold close to me.
4. if i cry or lose myself in an argument or confrontation, i feel like I'm "playing the victim".
5. i have the feelings of "I'm worthless", "maybe they would be better off without me", "i do nothing to help", "maybe I'm better off dead", and more; but on the last one, i cruelly remind myself that suic\*de is the "cowards way out of life", and somehow it convinces me.

I've also made a "facade" or multiple "facades" where I can be this charismatic, smart, funny, and chill individual, but it's more of a shell to hide the hurt inside myself, to the point I can almost act emotionally immature due to me acting more on impulse.

it hurts that this is where i am now, i have huge dreams for the future, i want to become a manga (Japanese comic) artist, and more; but this constantly haunts me, to the point i secretly made a deal with myself "if i don't make it big, I'm a failure"; and it stays in the back of my mind to this day.

so, kind people of this subreddit, what the hell is wrong with me?

(Edit: I'm not sure if I have depression or not, but this seemed to be the safest place for me to vent and to get positive feedback from, so sorry if this "offends you" or anything, that is NOT what I'm trying to say/go for, sorry in advance! 🙏)

title: Don’t function at any appreciable level
text:
Every foray into independence throughout my life has culminated in thorough psychosis. It takes maybe 2 months maximum every time before apathy and avolition relegate me to the bed and maybe the store for beer. Everyone observes me existing and infers that it is appropriate to treat me like a subhuman. I don’t even say or do anything before people are terrible to me. My landlord threw all of my possessions into the trash without having the courtesy of notifying me. Or perhaps even stole the valuables. lllegal act after illegal act but I imagine he assessed that I’m a 31 year old male with no friends, money or job and that he could do what he wants with impunity. And he’s kinda right, it’s too fucked up and sadistic for me to deal with. People don’t confer basic human decency on me. I don’t qualify. 
No quantifiable progress has been made toward anything ever. I’m still maybe developmentally 16 but I’m 31. I can’t condense 15 years of milestones and progress into a few weeks, hell even a few months. I’ve spent most of my adulthood horizontally decomposing in bed or vertically decomposing in a computer chair. No more youthful naïveté, I am now that maladjusted loser weirdo who makes people uncomfortable by just existing and I have been for some years. No exogenous intervention will occur and if solutions haven’t been internally derived over the course of the last decade or so, there’s no reason to believe it will happen tomorrow or next year or next decade. I don’t really want to go through another humiliation ritual of cartoonish failure at mimicking an adult. It doesn’t serve any purpose. Ive gleaned 0 insight. The ubiquitous feedback I get is shut up and fuck off and die.

title: I need help and I don’t know what to do.
text:
I’m 19 and I’m a male, I’ve felt overwhelmingly depressed for almost the past year now. It took me while to realize just how messed up I was. I want to keep this section short so I can paint a picture of how I’m feeling

For starters, the moment it really all started was when I moved from Maryland to North Carolina, that’s when my mental health went south. Normally a move is challenging but gives way to eventual triumphs and new experiences. Not for me though. My family and I moved down here in the summer of 2022 and it just so happens that I was a senior in highschool when I did move. So I spent all my life in Maryland and then move down here to North Carolina to spend my last year of high school with strangers. 

That wouldn’t be a problem to most, but for me, as the months went on, the more and more I thought how robbed I was of having spent my final year of highschool surrounded by my friends and teachers I’ve grown to know over the years. 

It was a gradual feeling at first though. It’s natural that you’ll be alone for the first few weeks when you know absolutely no one in a new highschool, but you’ll make friends. Not me though. As the months went on, I found myself increasingly lonely and isolated from everyone and everything, especially the day I graduated which felt like an absolute gut punch. Here I was, the most defining moment in supposed to be proud of… and I still felt like I was an alien amongst earthlings at my graduation because no one knew who I was, even after all that time… 

Now that we have a pretty good picture as to why I feel this way, I want to explain how I felt. Right around February of 2023 is when it really started happening. I would wake up early in the morning for school, a complete lack of motivation or energy to do anything. I would go to school anyway because I would fail if I didn’t. While at school, I didn’t do any work at all. Like nothing… then I would come home, feeling absolutely horrible for no reason, lay in bed, and start crying and obsessing over most of everything on my mind and what I was stressed about. That would happen for hours or a day or so at a time. 

Then the following day, I’d be perfectly fine, still tired and groggy, but fine nonetheless. I would go to school and do what was asked and required of me. 

It would continue on and off like that throughout the next year and into this one as well. I would wake up feeling horrible with no motivation to do anything and go back to bed or lounge around and play video games. And then some days, I would be fine… 

I get way more of these depressive episodes than I do actually good ones. It has gotten so bad that I feel absolutely no motivation to start taking steps into becoming an adult. I have no motivation to get a job or get my full drivers license. Everyone always tells me I need to go do it and to just get up and do it, but like I said, I feel absolutely no motivation to do it. Most days, I’m in my room, either in bed and watching tv or just playing video games while eating. 

Overall, I feel hopeless most days and sometimes even just completely shut down and spend the entire day in my room, just doing whatever to pass time until I get tired and go to bed. 

The long and short of it is, I didn’t start feeling depressed until February of last year, I have no motivation, always feel tired, go to bed and wake up at extremely late times, do nothing all day until I get tired and go to bed… 

I have absolutely no idea what to do or how to solve it. I don’t even feel motivated to provide any more context or information in this post… I’m sorry if I sound so ambiguous. But I just need help. I’m scared feeling this way will lead to something horrible happening to me in the future…

title: Suicide is imminent
text:
Im 22 yo with nothing to show for
Have no friends to form deep relationships with
I cant see a future where im not depressed constantly, suffering from severe bipolar and ocd which took over my life nearly a decade ago, i despise humanity as a whole and living means being a slave forever or confronting issues or milestones i dont want any part of.


I i hate women and men with a passion and think of all as the worst of mankind. No solace whatsoever other Than locking myself in a dark room and drinking my self unconscious, recently i started taking unprescribed medication in dangerous quantities hoping i dont wake up the next morning. Everything around me is so dark and negative and i cant deal with the thoughts or the nightmares which occur every single night

I feel worthless, like a gust of wind about to replace. I despise my family which mostly dealt harm as long as i can remember. Strangers are no different. There is no sympathy in this world and nothing makes sense. You could die tomorrow in the most horrific manner and the world keeps on spinning. It makes no sense. 

I’ve always been a good person, showing kindness and empathy to get none back.
I dont know why i deserve this. Maybe im unlikeable. Ego is too much and shattering it means the end of the world for me. Fuck man i might just do it someday, if only i had a gun
Nobody reads this shit but it is my letter and las respects. Its been nice living in a bottomless pit for 2 decades and change see ya baby

title: I feel like I'm running out of time
text:
The random compliments have stopped, the reassuring words of encouragement from those in my life are gone and I'm tired. I'm just tired all the time, I've slipped into a redundant routine where I am no longer productive at work or at home. I've stopped checking in on my friends because I don't have the energy for it anymore, the gesture has never been returned to me. I keep saying I'll keep going, and I will but it's hard and I don't have much left in me. 

Truth be told if my dog died today, I'd be gone tomorrow.

title: I don’t know what to do now
text:
For context, I live in a country where I get to choose what high school to go to via entrance exam.

I was pretty depressed and suicidal before I got into high school. I had just moved to a new country, and was struggling to make friends or study due to the language barrier. Despite this, I managed to get through it because I had hope that I could get into an English school and be able to communicate comfortably. I thought that i was depressed because of my environment, and once things got better I would be happy.

I’m now in an English high school, where I have close friends, a boyfriend, a family that loves me, and good education. I literally have everything I could want, but I don’t feel any better. I feel hopeless because if I have everything I want and still feel like this, how could I get any better? 

My attendance is shit because most days I feel like there’s no reason to go anymore. I have no hopes for the future. I go to therapy once a month, but I’m thinking of quitting because it seems unhelpful. I also take meds but I can’t tell if they’re even doing anything anymore. What do I do now?

title: Idolize my former abusive relationship cause it’s the only one I’ve ever had
text:
Clawed and fought and paid everything just to get that relationship too. That’s how fucking unlikable and unattractive I am. I had to give everything to her for a facsimile of love- for abuse. I literally saved her life AND SHE FUCKING ABUSED ME. She fucking ABUSED ME AND I SAVED HER. 

Is that your sick game god. Put me in these fucking situations saving someone also being made to feel like shit. Why don’t YOU JUST FINISH WHAT YOU FUCKING STARTED AND KILL ME. Kill me YOU FUCK.

If you can’t let me be loved, at least let me die a hero.

I’m in my late 20s now. The trajectory is set. Now if any person “””likes””” me, it’s going to be for money and money alone. I know you’re probably thinking that from a third person perspective I’m like some un-self aware jackass. But I genuinely have done a lot to try and be the best I can, socially too. But it’s not good enough. Because of what I am physically.

I do everything I can and it’s never enough. It never will be enough. How the fuck are you supposed to be “positive” when you are so unlikable and unattractive as this.

Truth is I’m tired of fighting. I’m so tired. Been fighting hard since kids attacked me on the playground or being raised to be a top competing student or what the fuck ever blah blah blah self pity. Always on a war footing. Always over the next hill- the dream. But when hope finally arrives, it’s some fucked up perversion of it.

People notice now. Me staring blankly into space or watching the horizon, frozen. They notice when my face contorts to pain or grim defeat. Doesn’t matter. It’ll only matter after I prematurely die.

All I ever wanted was to be loved.
And I’m starting to give up on that.

Nobody’s life is perfect.
But mine is really fucking with me.

At least tomorrow it’s just me. I don’t wanna deal with nothing.

My friend now… I love her, in a platonic way. I’m there for her. Helped her a lot. Always ask questions. I mention I’m depressed… not a further question about me. Just change the topic. I’m not mad though. Really. I want her to get with a guy and be happy as I fade away. That’s what we men gotta do. We gotta soldier on.

I’m listening to a whiter shade of pale.

At least I still cry. I still cry and claw my face to try and make it bleed a little. Shows I’m not a total corpse.

title: lost #3

title: what's the point in living?
text:
You're born, you grow up, go to school, find a job, grow up some more, get sick or grow old if you're lucky, you die.

What keeps you going? How did you find your goal in life? Because I certainly don't have them.

I graduated, I got a job, what now? 

It all just seems kind of pointless. I don't have any concrete thoughts of trying to end it all, but it's appealing I guess? The thought of disappearing and not existing anymore. I don't have to think about anything else. Just peace and quiet.

EDIT: I didn't think this post would have so many replies. But thank you for your efforts in giving me some answers. Some of these definitely made me think of what I really wanna do.

title: I think I'm starting to figure out how to live
text:
I'm a neurotic. I struggle mentally despite not having real problems. I'm always dwelling on the negative. Lately the issue I ruminate on is my retirement. Even if I save a lot I will be unprepared. I shouldn't have been a loner. If I got married and put down for a house I could look forward to my retirement in a home that was paid for. But I never thought that far ahead. Wasn't disciplined enough. So now I hope suicide options for old people become legal because how am I going to support myself in a home when I'm old? 

My dad said I turned my back on my family every time I tried to suicide. I think he's right. I want to change.

I recognize that I'm a neurotic. I feel guilty about my life. I have lived a blessed life in a good country and still I was miserable the whole time. All I do is work and watch tv. I feel like I should be doing something about the evil in the world but I'm just an ordinary person. I can't even take care of myself.

My new slogan is "cook and be happy". So basically I give up on trying to be a good person. All I'm good for is taking it one day at a time. 

I give up on math. I accept that I can't take it in. I accept that it makes my mental health worse without showing tangible results.  I wanted to make robots but I think it's time to accept that dream is out of my reach.

I feel like I'm supposed to do something with my life. I keep judging myself for how little I do but I think my mental health will be better if I tell myself it's ok to just work and take things one day at a time.

Thank you for your time. I just wrote here because I have no one to talk to. I'm ok not having anyone to talk to as long as I have somewhere to vent occasionally.

title: Disabled and depressed
text:
Hello,

I am 23 years old. I used to be happy and my life was going so well. I had a cancer diagnosis when I was 16 in high school. I ended up staying in a hospital for a year and lost my leg. High school was the most fun chapter in my life and I feel like I was robbed of it.

Fast forward 7 years and I am now in university studying engineering. However, my disability and mental health state has made my progression in university very slow as in I'm almost failing everything. I used to be a very good student. I have no friends in university and ever since my surgeries I've struggles to make friends or talk to people.

I get so much FOMO when all my old friends played all the sports I wish I could play with them. It pains me not to be able to do things that are usually a given to people. I almost feel like a liability when I hang out with my friend group. I feel robbed of what could've been the best times of my life.

Eventually I've stopped taking care of myself. I've had more episodes where I would sit and cry or fall asleep and cry. I turned to drugs to make me happy and my bank account has taken a hit due to it. I feel like a really big failure in my parents eyes as they have invested so much into me.

I feel so alone. I've would've never ever thought of suicide. However, lately it's been in the back of my mind. I can't bear to wonder what my parents or friends and family's reactions would be. I love them so much and I just don't know what to do. I am a failure.

title: There is no rock bottom with depression
text: I thought I hit rock bottom four years ago and it couldn't get worse. I slept on my mental health and did not seek help. Things have recently gotten worse and I did finally start getting help with a therapist. My single biggest piece of advice I give my friends is to not ignore your mental health. Find help early even over small things. It can always get worse. The void of mental health misery is infinite.

title: How to help my husband
text:
My husband just came home from work which he left early because he had a panic attack. He is an ER Nurse and normally fine under pressure. I know he has been suffering from depression and is seeing a therapist, but it doesn't seem to be helping much.
He is also on 300mg wellbutrin prescribed by his pcp. I asked him if he wanted to go to a crisis center in the morning but he said that is for people who are suicidal. But I think having a panic attack so bad that you have to leave work seems like a crisis? I don't know what to do or how to help him. Any advice or suggestions appreciated.

title: Isolating myself is a new thing
text:
There are about 3 people in my life who kinda halfway have been making an effort to check in on me.

But my god, I am such a waste of their time.

I isolate myself from them.

The energy to reply, to respond, isn't there. I have halfway given up on myself.

These people are so kind but i'm a lost cause.

I'll spend my days alone in my own company.

I feel like they couldn't understand what I'm going through, and I also don't want them to get irritated when I show little to no signs of improvement, when I am hiding cuts on my arms underneath my sleeves, when i am losing weight because I have no appetite anymore.

I never noticed myself isolating like this before. Scientifically and objectively it is interesting to me to watch a symptom like this worsen over time but emotionally on a personal level this is heartbreaking

title: What's the point of doing your best if it's never enough?
text: I'm tired. I'm always self sabotaging everything. Opportunities. My heath. My relationships.

title: Feels almost good to be depressed
text:
I’m not sure if anyone else has ever felt this way but I (33m) almost lean into it. It’s like a drive to wreck my life. It completely changes my focus and I turn to a bit of self-destruction. Substance use, risky behavior, being on Reddit (frankly). I keep it secret from family and friends and no one seems to notice. 

I also find a lot of comfort in SI. Like “how bad could this situation possibly be? I can always ___”. It genuinely reframes my anxiety and makes things more manageable. 

Is any of that ok?

title: Pain and Suffering
text: There is so much pain and suffering in the world. I don't know how everyone doesn't just crumble underneath the weight of it all. I find myself obsessing over other people's pain (as well as my own) and that tends to spiral me downward. Does anyone else relate?

title: I don't know how much longer I feel like this...
text:
I don't know what I am looking for posting this really...but lately I just don't find joy in anything (and by lately I mean the last 3-4 years).   


I used to get excited about progressing in my career, dating, seeing friends...and everything that used to bring me joy does absolutely nothing. I have lost two major people in my life the last two years, I am over $20,000 in debt largely due to that (I didn't work for a long time when I lost my niece then when I was starting to get my life together my dad passed...in the middle I had an unexpected move when my roommate decided to leave without notice forcing me to find a new apartment).   


I am in a constant state of numbness and sadness at the same time...I have tried antidepressants multiple times and have gone off them (I still feel sad I just am unable to express it). I have done therapy in the past but can't afford it so that's not an option...If anyone has been in a similar position as myself and has any tips let me know because I don't know how much longer I can feel this way.

title: Life is complex and hard
text:
I am going through a hard time rn and I feel alone. I am in a relationship but we are struggling rn, I don't know why. I have flaws, but I didn't do anything bad. 
I am emotionally not well and it makes me think in a way I didn't before. Life is really just very hard and often unfair. You can do anything in your power, but you still don't get rewarded or appreciated. Sometimes you even get punished for it or treated poorly. It's really depressing.
I never did anything bad to anyone, but I can understand now that people who did mistakes, of course within limits, are still normal humans with feelings. People who made mistakes arent necessarily bad people.
I don't even know why that is on my mind. I even do a lot for my partner, but for some reason I am thinking of people who do mistakes.
It's just my thoughts I needed to release and for someone to read.

title: Been feeling really bad lately, and my insecurities are clawing at my head
text:
All i ask is someone reads this, idc abt the messages. Just for a sec, i want to feel like without names or personal emotions attached i can exist. 

Im 23 and ive started to feel horrible about myself all over again, some weeks i can overlook it and just live and i feel i can forget. But something will happen and ill remember all the things i wish i could change. All the things ill never get to be. 

Im ranting not because i care for reasoning or care about being cared about, all of that is subjective, and honestly ive hated thinking about people caring about me it annoys me so much. But i legitametely have no one to talk to. My parents ive never been personal with, my brother and i dont get along, my friends from work are amazing, i just had a cook out with them yesterday, but i dont want to scare them away with my problems. Theyre not therapists for me to be running to them about my bullshit issues. My other friends are too involved in their own issues. My situationship of two years who is my ex who i was with for three years,(5years knowing each other) she had cheated on me, and i cant let go bcz im afraid i wont ever be sorta “loved” or used in that manner. (yes im that pathetic)


Im ranting because i feel the end is near, ever since i was about 16-17 i always knew id die young and i fully encourage it. I never want to be some old wrinkly 76 yo with alzheimers or someone having to clean my poop for me. I never wanted to get married either. All of that, have kids, buy a house, get a mortgage, get old bullshit isnt for me. Ive just never been good enough, or felt good enough.

I was never picked first, i never had positive encouragement in school, i was never someones crush, and i always feel like people deep down are creeped out by me. I can tell by the look in their eyes, they think im some sort of criminal or vermin amongst them. My job is an office job and i feel myself just becoming a number that clocks in and out, ive never felt so alone and forgotten. And lately all my insecurities have amplified the feeling, ive never been one to do all that lame “man i feel suicidal” for me its like once its time its time. There is no beating around the bush, seeing if someone cares or crying for help. 

I wish there was a way i could fall off the face of the earth without having people worry about me, im really just another face in the crowd, another number, so overlooked, dont care about me afterwards i dont want you to. Just forget i exist, just erase myself from everyones memories, to never been looked for, to never be found, i dont want there to even be a single blood drop of me, i dont want there to be a cell of me, no ashes no nothing. No memories, no records, no recollections, not even my name or who i was. No funerals, no crying, no feeling bad, dont even feel sorry for me. 


All my life ive been looked at the same way, dont feel sorry for me, dont treat me like im less, even if i am, all my life has been living by other people with their judgement, their customs, their stupid norms, their stupid morals and codes, rules and regulations to how one should be, act, feel, or behave. Im tired of living my life on my knees, who says i must live under the feet of everyone like a cockroach? God? Society?. I am the byproduct of societys flawed ways, and yet im supposed to feel bad for being what society made me. 

I am not unhinged, i am perfectly normal functioning “member” of society. If you can even call it that, i am in every sense of the word a slave. 

A slave to a hyper industrialized society.
A slave to how my parents want me to be. 
A slave to my own ways.
A slave to how i must look. 
A slave to peoples thoughts about me.
A slave to thinking i should care.
A slave to always feeling this way. 

I dont know why i feel this way, but its the way ive always felt. 

Rant over.

Mainly because I feel like this was all my fault and if I had fought harder or done something (don't know what) I would have been ok.

title: TL;DC my life is a mess
text:
Im a F28. So I have a bachelor of writing and a masters in digital humanities but after covid my family convinced me to go into something that’ll earn me more money and get me a job. 

So I started an allied health degree.  I’m in my third year now and have two years to go. I’m struggling. I own a unit but can’t afford it. I’m working and studying full time and have zero savings. I’ve been in the red more times than I care to admit these past two years. 

My parents are helping a bit but they always go on about how they need to support me. And it just makes me feel so shitty because they are very intrusive and coddling without meaning to be. And like I’m 28 so I’m kind of over it. Other people my age are not relying on their parents or doing what they tell them to do as much as I am. 
I told my parents that I was thinking of taking a leave of absence from my study so I could work on my job and save money. And it would benefit my mental and physical health. But they don’t want me to take a break from study and they want me to finish my degree as soon as possible. 

I love my current job in aged care but the thing is my dream is to live and work overseas and publish my own book. 
I’ve been studying almost non stop for the past 10 years. I’m sick of it. 
I think about death sometimes and it’s become more prevalent in recent years. 
I went and studied in Italy for a month in January and it was the happiest and most free I had felt in about three years. 

I’m also bi and maybe Demi gender but I have to hide that from my parents. And it doesn’t help that this town is so small so there’s no community here. It’s just my parents. 

I need to start making my own decisions but I’m stuck. Idk what to do. I just have too much guilt and shame and I always fucking listen to my parents and let them control my life. 
And then I go home and lose myself on my phone and sleep and the cycle starts again. 
My parents say that it’s only two more years of this and then you’ll have your degree. But they don’t seem to understand that I can’t survive two more years of this. No matter how many times I tell them.

title: I’m trying to quit Zoloft, but I feel like shit. [18F]
text:
A few weeks ago I made the decision to taper off Zoloft (Sertraline). I’ve been decreasing with 12.5mg/week, I’ve gone from 125mg to 62.5mg.

I thought it was going well, until my anxiety started appearing more frequently and I relapsed back into SH again. I’ve also become more careless, taking unnecessary risks. I cried a few days ago, which is unusual for me. I don’t know if it’s just my yearly anxiety about the peak of certain infectious illnesses, or if it’s the Zoloft.

Maybe I just haven’t distracted myself enough like I usually do. Or maybe it’s seeing my friends get into relationships, while I’m stuck as the third wheel.

I’m not sure I’m writing coherently at this point, I’m sleepy, but thanks to those who read my little rant.

title: Why not? Here's my post.
text:
I do not know what to think anymore, I don't know what to think of myself. I have a face, I have a body but they don't feel like they belong to me. I look at my hands and I see shapes made of flesh, not a person, not a man, just some bastardized machine. I feel as if I am just some construct, given a mind and forced to walk this earth with no clue as to what I was possibly intended for. 

What value does freedom have, when each choice we make is so insignificant? I don't feel pleasure in most things I do, truth be told. Food tastes unremarkable, music grows dull after the first few times listening to it. I've found myself having sex with other men, just for the sake of feeling something, anything that could possibly change my perspective. Ironic, considering I always had a distaste for it. It's unfulfilling, disappointing. 

Ultimately, I feel apathetic in regards to life. There was once a time where the thought of death genuinely excited me, albiet due to a martyr complex. I miss that, and honestly, dying for the sake of something I can say I cherish, even if it's for my own selfish wants.. well, it's a thought I find myself entertaining more often.

title: Fictional Character

This charater ended up with a different guy and not the main charater I've been rooting for for years. This bothered me so much that I couldn't focus in my workplace anymore. At some point I couldn't sketch at all cause with what happened to the character it really got stuck in my head. Sketching was my only way of relieving stress and I couldn't get that character out of my head. At times I would physically hurt myself, bang my head in the wall, or punch my face to forget about it. I just want to forget about it, you know? I'm just so tired of it. 

This shouldn't be a big deal cause I mean, yeah they're fictional and there are other bigger problems than this. Maybe its part of the writers story, and yet it really hit me. Because of that I couldn't enjoy other stories anymore because of this mentality. I just want to forget about it you know. Or mentally separate myself from fictional characters that I loved. Any advice you could give me?

title: Blessing and a curse!
text:
I just wanted to share a little bit with you all about what's going on with me at the moment. I'm not sharing because I want you to feel sorry for me. I'm sharing because I want to raise awareness for others who are struggling as much as I am. I've been diagnosed with bipolar disorder, severe depression, anxiety, and PTSD. It's been six years since my diagnosis, but I've been suffering from these conditions since I was 13 or even younger. I've had good years and bad years, and I've been hospitalized in the past due to my suicidal thoughts. I've been doing really well until recently. Life has brought me so many ups and downs throughout the years. I have learned how to embrace this curse and blessing at the same time. It can be a curse because it can drop me to the ground and put me on a roller coaster that spins around and around and never stops. It's like having many demons fighting a war against each other, and it feels like it never ends and you can't see the light at the end of the tunnel. But it can also work as a blessing in the way that you can see how others struggle and you can relate to them. You can help them and be there for them, and it also makes you see the beauty in life because it's too short and can be gone in a blink of an eye. 
The reason I feel the way I do at the moment is not because of anybody hurting me or my job. About a year ago, I had surgery, and the doctor told me that my medicine intake might not affect me the same way and that I might have to have it adjusted here and there. It's been a year, and my medication hasn't been working like it should. I finally got it adjusted, and I hope it works and helps me out. I didn't realize how bad it was getting until recently. My thoughts were getting bad, and my demons were hunting me. The emotions of the roller coaster—the ups and downs, control—were all is coming back and hitting me hard. I couldn't see the light.
I am fighting this fight with all my might, and I have the support to battle it. The resources are the tools. I'm using them to make me stronger.
I want everybody to know that I'm thankful to have this support that I have. It has taken me years to accept support from people. I thought I was okay alone, but I was wrong. I want to say I am so thankful and blessed.
For the people that have been there for me, thank you so much for listening to me and putting up with me. I'm thankful to have a job that supports me, with amazing management that has supported me in their own ways. I have nothing but positive things to say about it, and the coworkers/friends there that have been a great support. P.S. I miss you all at the moment.
Now, if you guys wonder why I'm always smiling and trying to be happy and positive all the time, and always seeing the good in the bad, in trying to find a solution for people's problems and trying to help them out as much as I can, now you might understand me more. 
"Memento Vivere" (Remember to live)
Like my tattoo says, which is a reminder to me every day.
Last but not least, thank you to my amazing fiancé.
Without you, I would be lost, more than I have ever been.
Thank you for putting up with me, supporting me, and not judging me.
I am accepting myself for who I am, with all my flaws. And to my beautiful daughters, thank you for accepting me with my flaws and not judging me, and for helping me when I need it most. I love you all with all my heart. You have guided me to the light.

title: I'm not eating properly - At what point should I be seriously concerned?
text:
I live in a house with serval roommates, where we mostly keep to ourselves. I've got to the point where I don't venture outside of my bedroom during the day, as I don't want to encounter anyone. However, this makes basic things difficult. It's a challenge to access the bathroom, only daring to venture through the hallway like once or twice a day.

When it comes to food, I used to cook after midnight. I would eat breakfast food and a frozen meal. It was only 2 meals "a day", but I was getting mostly what I needed. Recently, when it reaches 12:00/1:00 am, I'm too tired to go downstairs and cook for myself. As I'm writing this, its been 48 hours and I've only eaten some chocolate bars readily in my room. I don't know if I'll reach the 72 hour mark without eating so much as breakfast.

At what point does depression become a danger to your physical wellbeing? Do I need to phone someone to intervene, or is this a bad phase that will pass and I can get through it on my own terms?

title: The pain is horrible
text:
Dear friends,

I want to express my gratitude to this community and to everyone taking the time to read this message. Today, I feel the need to share and seek some moral support. Three years ago, my mother tragically passed away from leukemia, leaving behind only my father, my little brother, and me. I've been grappling with the challenge of providing for my family while striving to be a supportive brother.

Until about six months ago, I was managing a large furniture store, when suddenly, I began feeling weakness in both of my legs. Initially, I didn't pay much attention to it and continued working. However, the weakness progressed rapidly, accompanied by severe fatigue. I depleted all my savings on numerous doctor visits and tests, only to be diagnosed with multiple sclerosis—a condition with no cure but can be managed with medication.

Here in Venezuela, affording such medication is beyond my means, and public healthcare is insufficient. My only hope lies in traveling to Spain to access better healthcare and manage my symptoms. Sadly, I lack the financial means to make this journey. I share my story in the hopes that it may resonate with you all and perhaps, in sharing, I may find strength.

Let us all cherish our health, for it is a precious gift that we often take for granted.

title: Reflecting on My Life: Dealing with Regrets and Moving Forward
text:
Life often feels like a game of chess, doesn't it? Every choice we make shapes our journey, and just like in chess, every move counts. But what about the ones we wish we could take back? 

As someone who's made my fair share of wrong moves, I'm seeking advice on how to cope and move forward. How do we make peace with the moves we've made when they seem to weigh us down?

There are times when I can't help but dwell on the choices I've made – the ones that led me here and the ones that didn't. It's like I'm stuck in a loop, wondering what could have been. Even though I believe everything happens for a reason, it's tough to shake off the regret.

My teenage years were a mess. I made so many mistakes – in friendships, love, school, you name it. And getting mixed up with drugs and alcohol? That only made things worse. Looking back, I can't help but think about the missed chances and the roads not taken.

I'm not alone in this, right? I bet plenty of us struggle with the same thing. How do you deal with knowing that life could have been different if you'd made different choices?

title: My best friends try to mess up with my brain
text:
I(23M) have been struggling with depression and I get panicked easily. Since last year I have started to forget things quite quickly. I do not notice where I keep my things properly. My friends are aware about this situation but they aren't serious about it because we have been never too open about mental health with each other.
They intentionally hide my things and make me get panicked about it. They need to understand that I don't care about the things but I hate myself for forgetting things quickly and it is resulting in more self hate and suicidal thoughts. I don't blame them , we have been like this since we were kids, but I am not same anymore.
Yesterday they took one of my airpod, which is not even that important to me but I kept searching for it for an hour and I was so scared for no reason. I wish I could punch them in the face and tell them not to mess with my already messed up mind.

title: Depressive symptoms that go away for a few hours, come back, go away, and so on
text:
I’ve had this issue where I feel fine for a little (though there’s always a little dread, because I know that it’s not going to last) and then I feel depressed for a little, and then it just kind of cycles over. Each of these never last more than a day; it switches around every few hours, so I know that it can’t be depression, as I’ve read that it lasts for at least two weeks at a time (? This has been going on for a few months, but I never have an episode that lasts as long as that. I also don’t get manic or anything, so I’ve crossed BPD off the list. 

Does anyone have any similar experiences or input? I’m lost.

title: I don't enjoy music anymore, among other things
text:
The last time I can remember genuinely, (and frequently) enjoying music was .. 2021?

It’s so weird to say that you don’t enjoy music anymore. 

People look at you like you’ve got six heads.. every now and then I’ll get into something, but it’s so rare. And I can’t stand the feeling of listening to music with earphones anymore - it makes me feel detached from reality and then I start feeling certain unpleasant emotions, and I generally hate that. I don’t get it.

My emotional range since 2022 has basically been stress, anxiety, frustration, anger, irritability, helplessness, weariness.

I can’t stand the feelings of regret, shame, and nostalgia, so I avoid experiences that would trigger those. Unfortunately, music triggers that and so do most attempts at getting in touch with my old hobbies, or really any hobbies at all. It hits me with horrible waves of emotional pain and panic - then those feelings start a process where I realize that I don’t recognize myself anymore. I start to feel weird, old, and like I’m not dissimilar to the portrait of Dorian Gray, that slowly mutated and melted into something disgusting over time that people no longer recognize. I feel like a shell, like something repulsive and I feel repulsed by myself. But if I continue operating on a “business as usual”, avoiding-all-triggers wavelength, then I don’t have to acknowledge those feelings and it’s as if they don’t exist.

Does anyone else find that when they try to "get back in touch with themselves", they feel a sense of contempt for even bothering? In an, "Oh really? You think that's going to work? Get over yourself" kind of way?

title: Another depressed person
text:
40m, 2 kids at 7yo, married for 10 years.. 

Seems like posts here do not get much responses but that is ok. I just want to write probably.. 

I am extremely lonely. We moved to Canada 6 years ago and even tho I did make friends from time to time they all moved to smaller cities and I lost contact with them slowly as we could not meet anymore. 

I do not trust my judgement anymore. I can't tell if I am in a horrible marriage or not for example. I can't tell if I am a good father or not. 

Every day is the same and same as in very boring. I do not get any compassion from anyone, including my wife. Maybe she hates me, I do not know. Maybe I am too busy with myself I also do not show her any compassion and do not even realize the love she has for me.

Last weekend I went out to get fruit juice for the kids, and instead of going to the usual nearby store I drove to a random far away one, just to spend some time with myself, to drive.. It took me more than an hour to come back, something that should have been 10 to 15 minutes most. 

She did not call. She did not even ask why it took me so long when I was back. I was wondering if she would call.  

I feel like nobody, not a single person cares about me. 

I love my kids. I would never leave them. I am wondering if we would be divorced by now already if we did not have kids. I do not know. Or I would have been alive. Seriously. I do not see any reason. 

I just want to save as much as I can for my kids in the next 10 / 11 years (if I can keep employed as it is getting harder and harder for me as I underperform due to being in such a state)  and just go find a grave or something, really. 

I enjoy nothing, I want nothing. I feel like life has ended. I failed. I do not make enough money. I will be renting for the next 50 years probably and it will probably a basement eventually - that if I can convince anyone to rent their basement to a weird divorced single man who is clearly going to die in his sleep or something. If I go back home I will just regret it more as I will feel a bigger failure. If I stay here we are pretty much broke. Lonely. 

When I talk to my wife about how I need more love and caring she just gets defensive. The problem is maybe she is right. I do not even know. Maybe no matter how much she cares about me I will ask for more. Maybe what I want is something else? Is it just me getting old and having a depression due to that? I do not know. 

I am tired all the time, burned out from work (I work in IT), there are layoffs, I am stressed, if I am laid off and go unemployed for a while oh my god I will feel even worse. 

Sometimes I feel I should have never had kids as I am a big failure clearly. I love them so much but the responsibility is so big. I can't just abandon them. And what am I going to do if I move out anyway? Like everything is going to be perfect all of a sudden? Life will be difficult for my wife too, something I do not want. 

I will stop now. I feel dizzy and numb. 

Thanks for reading.

title: I want to help
text:
I’ve tried to find other solutions, but I don’t know where else to go, so I turned here. 
I (15F) have an older sister, (17F) I’ll call Kay in this post. 

I love my sister, and she has depression but won’t get help for it. She’s having severe mood swings and lashing out at everyone in the family, me and my mother getting the brunt of it. She’s closing herself off, drowning herself in school work from the 3 AP classes she decided to take this year.
 
When Kay is happy, it’s all fine. She’s smiling and we laugh and get along. But even then, we have to walk on eggshells. If we say one wrong thing or bring up one bad memory, she shuts down and cries. She doesn’t listen to reason, and she won’t accept any apologies or consolation. But she does this right back to us. Being teenagers, we often roast each other, and what drives me insane is that she tears me apart, and it hurts really bad, as she brings up bad past memories and feelings. But I say one comment like her long hair clogs the drain a lot, and she cries and shuts down. 

 But when she goes through an episode, which is happening more often, She is super sensitive and cries at things we say in passing, when we don’t mean any harm or she took it a different way. She locks herself in her room for hours at a time, and either scrolls or does homework. And again, not accepting apologies or consolation. 

I love her so much. And I know that she’s really going through it. And I just want to be able to help her get through it. But I’m continually getting abused by her because of her mental states. How do I help her without getting hurt, physically or mentally?

title: I feel better tdy, and I hope you’ll too
text:
5 years, depression never really goes away. But I feel better tdy, I go to class and started my summative presentation. Baby steps like this is gd, makes me happy. I think exercise, sleeping regularly and talk to ppl helps. 

Some days are shit, some weeks are shit, but let it be. If you fell, rest. Heal, no one is forcing you to get back up, so take some rest,  be unproductive, be useless, be mundane. And when you’re ready, just go ahead, take some baby steps and appreciate your effort.

title: Guilty of blocking & ghosting people you love? Please 🙋‍♀️
text:
Hey everyone,

I'm wondering how common it is to block AND ghost people you love, who love you, who are low-pressure (or at least try to be).  At first, I don't feel like responding to people even though they're just letting me know they care. And eventually, I have to block them so I don't feel guilty that I'm not responding to them. If I can't see them texting me, I can't feel bad about not responding.

Do you ever come out of this phase? How long did it take to feel comfortable talking to people again? How hard was it to reach back out? Was anyone angry with you? Is there anything anyone could have said you help you feel better, or do you think the block was worth it?

I think (and am hoping) I am dealing with Seasonal Affective Disorder and this will end as summer nears, but I worry it won't. It started in November. So it will have been a while since I cut people off.

Thanks\~!

title: Venting
text: So…99% I have no fucking idea what’s going on in my brain. One minute I have the strongest urge to leave this life & all the struggles and sadness that comes with it. Then the next, I feel optimistic-“light at the end of the tunnel” kind of thinking. And I don’t get it. Therapy is a fluke. The ones I’ve been looking for don’t accept my insurance (and I’m broke) and the last psychiatrist I had was shitty…prescribed me Lexapro before even meeting with a therapist. I’ve been applying to jobs and it feels like they are all fucking against me, I am sooo tired of hearing “we’re not hiring” or literally hearing nothing back after applying and calling. My family used to support me financially but I guess lately shits hit their pockets too so I don’t ask anymore and I’ve been trying to just do it on my own. The repetitiveness of school, coming home, looking for a job, then occasionally doing schoolwork is driving me crazy. I have a boyfriend but I literally can’t even put my full 100% into our relationship cause I feel like a loser to the fullest. As a psych major I somewhat understand what’s going on, but once the depression hits…it hits and I want to kms genuinely. This might be TMI but idc, I literally was even thinking about turning my life to sex working but part of me must still hold myself to a different standard so I don’t know. I feel so stuck and reading everyone’s posts, I know I’m not alone, but that makes it worse imo. I literally constantly question if I’ll get better and I just don’t think I will. When I look around at my life it’s so null. I feel like I don’t know who I am anymore and it hurts.

title: I'm just on autopilot these days
text:
I have been alone since my mother left to go visit her grandkids abroad. I never really felt lonelinesss like this before since I'm on vacation and don't really have many peoole I can hang out with.

For the  last week, I've been having chest pains that feel like someone is poking my heart when I breathe. At times, the pain rings throughout my upper left side. If it's not chest pain, it's been migraines, ear infections, depressive episodes or just feeling fatigued  all day. 

Besides that, I have not really had anyone to speak to. I've reached out to vent but just get one word replies if they reply at all. Any attempts to hang out have been failures. If I don't message anyone to chat, my only conversations will be persons who need to vent or want me to be their shoulder to cry on without returning the favour.

Met a girl who I was interested in. First time I've wanted to spend time with someone but my advances always seem stifled. It's either feigned interest to not be rude or uninterested replies so that's dead before it even started. I don't know why I even waste the energy sometimes. 

It's a shame that I can't even talk to those around me. I just have to wallow in my thoughts until something  wakes me up, talk to my online friend who lives on another continent (who I can't keep dumping onto), or  make a desperate attempt to have conversations with "friends" where I just end up being spoken over or ignored.

Not suicidal, just wish I could find peace in my life.

title: I just want to get better but cannot understand why I am being set back
text: I have done nothing but lose the people I love, in and out of mental hospitals, constantly going to the actual hospital due to anxiety and psychosis, crying myself to sleep due to how lonely I am, stay in my room and daydream the loneliness away, don’t drive as much, I hate my body, I hate my looks, I hate myself, the list goes on. I try to do better so bad but wtf keeps knocking me down? I tried and tried to get my shit together but failed each time resulting in me being even more depressed. I have been through so fucking much I am tired it just seems like I don’t have the strength to keep my head high and push through. Why is it so hard just to live and function? I feel like I fail at doing the one thing I am meant to do naturally. I feel so defeated I just need to get better. I need a miracle at this point seriously.

title: I only feel a sense of calm once it gets dark outside. I literally wait for it to get dark every day to have some relief.
text:
I feel so weighed down by the responsibilities of the day which likely plays a part in this, but I think something might be up with my circadian rhythm. I feel "safe" when it is dark outside and like there is something I need to fear when it is daylight. Seeing daylight brings me instant anxiety. There is a feeling of almost desperation waiting for night so I can feel some comfort. I do not stay up late which makes me feel like I have less and less time in my window of comfort as summer is coming where I live and the days are getting longer. I realize this may sound completely insane, but yes I feel insane.

Has anyone else experienced this? Any solutions?

title: I just found out they’ll take my tax check
text: After receiving unemployment they told me they overpaid by $1800 after a few payments and no reduction in the amount I gave up on it. There was no warning that I wasn’t supposed to collect and then I owe a lump sum. I have been looking forward to this tax check for so many reasons. Tell my mother and of course it’s my fault somehow, it’s fine. She’ll just live lavishly off my deceased father’s money going to the casino and Vegas. Less than a year after he passed she was paying some man’s rent and his daughters. While I was literally homeless. I was the only one that spent anytime with the man. He was my best friend.

title: For people with depression who believe they are unorganized or messy
text: You're not, believe me. You're not unorganized or messy by nature. You're depressed and that's okay. Remember mess is neutral, everyone, even neurotypical people, has it from time to time. You can do something about it, picking up one thing on the floor, do your laundry. It is a habit that you can develop and learn through time. You're not doomed to be like this forever. You can change.

title: Does this sound like a depressive episode?
text:
Looking for advice/help in regards to husband’s mental state/health while sick

29M
6’3 
215 pounds
Non-smoker
Non-drinker
No recreational drug use
Prescribed Fluoxetine for GAD and depression

My husband was diagnosed with Flu A this past week (Tuesday 2/20) and this has seemed to kick off a depressive episode and I am just looking for any and all advice. He was already dealing with some stress from a new job he started and everyday he’d come home from work he just seemed so down, overwhelmed, and depressed. But eventually it would subside. Ever since having the flu he has been in this state that he can’t really describe but he is just feeling an overwhelming amount of anxiousness and depression wash over him and nothing seems to make it go away. He can barely eat, get out of bed, get out of the house, or make sense of what he is feeling. He has taken Ativan a few times but it does not seem to help anything other than make him fall asleep. I would just like an understanding of what could be going on, could this be a depressive episode that is lasting? He had a couple of panic attacks in between, but I understand those do not last days. 

He just finished his last dose of Tamiflu yesterday (Sunday 2/25) and he was also prescribed Azrithromycin and Methylprednisone on Friday (2/23), but his symptoms began before starting the antibiotics and steroids. 

It seems anytime he gets really sick he enters into this state and it will last days if not weeks. Could there be something more going on unrelated to anxiety and depression? 

He has an appointment with his psychiatrist tomorrow. Is there anything that can provide him immediate relief? He has been missing work and just feels scared and doesn’t know what is going on.

title: Waiting, not living.
text:
I used to be an extrovert with lots of friends, good people, but I did something bad many years ago and my life went to the toilet. That I deserved. 
Since then I've managed to hold onto my closest friends, for which I'm lucky. I have a secure home of my own, good health, right attitude and fulfilling interests. 
But I'm waiting to die of old age. I'm not even 40 yet. 
I spend so much time on my own that my brain does backflips when I'm around people. I can go weeks without saying a single word. And the worst part is I like all of this, I shouldn't. 
I don't want a partner or children, I only take work that lets me plug my ears in, and my only dream is to completely unplug and answer to no one.
I find joy and solace in being creative, making music, cooking, drawing, writing, horticulture and a couple others. Next to that everything else doesn't come close, and I think that's just plain cold, I don't want to undervalue anything or anyone. 
I'll say it again, I'm very very lucky. But that final curtain looks like a pint of water after a trek through the Sahara.

title: Going to throw my phone away
text:
Technology is it a gift or a curse? I don't know, what I do know in fact is that I just can't live like this anymore.

Social media, especially Youtube, Instagram has become a place of self-hatred for me.

I just can't deal with all these opinions and all this information overdose, the constant thought stream and thinking is just too much.

I don't want to participate in this fake world anymore.

Screens are polluting our minds and our ability to function as humans. 

We really need to snap out all of it this crap.

Call me crazy, label me as weird. It doesn't matter to me anymore.

I'm done with this world.

title: I don't want to visit School anymore.
text:
I (m16) have been diagnosed with Depression at the age of 12. Antidepressants are not an option, since they clash with my other Meds.

I cant seem to talk to People anymore, or maintain my social life in any way. I am **extremely** forgetful because of my ADHD, so i mostly even forget to text up the friends, that i have left.

I find myself not being able to talk in school anymore, as if raise the word for even a split second, someone either laughs, or people rip on me for speaking.

I transferred schools (at age 15) because of Teacher-sided racism, discrimination and disadvantage. I was never the kind of unsocial person, but when i had to get used to a new environment and new people everything changed.

I knew a couple of people there, because its a very small town i live in and most of the people going to the Gesamtschule (German middle school) also went to my Primary school.

I told myself to make a new start for myself and introduced myself to my new classmates. I never wsnted to start crossing with someone or be mean in any way. 

That apparently wasn't enough tho because it only took 2 weeks for comments about my looks (Im Half haitian and Half Moroccan so i have darker skin and short Curly hair) So they were mostly about hoe my hair looks and that i didnt shave my sides. So i did that, and more comments were made. 

I dont know what to do. Today someone snatched my phone out of my hands while unlocked, and deleted all my Photos and Apps somehow. I was on the verge of suicide because (some were directly stating i should) i dont feel like i have a Place anywhere. 

How do i make it stop? Please help me

title: Depression is getting so bad my eyes are closing by themselves now
text: I dont even feel tired right now (though usually I do), yet I feel so goddamn sad my head is nodding forward and eyes are closing and I can barely keep them open. I pbysically FEEL the complete lack of dopamine in my system, my brain cannot sense a single particle of it floating around in my system. And I dont even know what im depressed about anymore. Ive been this way for so many years now i dont even remmeber how to be genuinely happy anymore, and now this emptiness is the new normal. I'm scared of going to the doctor, because I dont want to become medicated. I dont want to be dependent on a drug, yet I started vaping which I previously looked down upon. I dont want antidepressants, but it's the only thing that could probably help me i dont know. I can barely type, I can't see the keayboard anymroe.

title: I need help creating a daily routine. I'm home alone all day and have a very limited income.
text:
There is nothing more depressing than waking up almost every day knowing that you're going to spend the day alone.  I don't have a car.  I have a treatment team that visits me 2-3 times a week and I go to a substance abuse group weekly.  Most weeks, one of my visits is from a therapist.

My family is very supportive, but I can't and don't expect them to work to fill that void.  That's on me.  My parents live almost an hour away, and most weeks, they pick me up on Friday morning and take me home Monday morning.  They are so incredible!  But they have lives of their own too.

I really would love to get myself into a routine.  I always loved having a routine as a child and through college.  I like to know what to expect and being productive.  But I live alone and not near anyone that I could socialize with.  I have very limited income, which makes things a little more complicated.

Please, make suggestions of what I could include in my daily/weekly routines!  Also, I have been having panic attacks since Thursday.  I would really love to find someone to chat with online.  Someone who knows what I'm going through, even if only slightly, would assuage me so greatly.

Thank you for reading and have a great day!  :)
